One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:Where may I view sharks in a clear tunnel? Choices:  A: south pacific B: sea world C: pacific ocean D: indian ocean E: gulf of mexico<n><n>### Response:		A. south pacific<n><n>### Input?<n>How much did the train ticket and gas tanker both cost to fill the truck?<n><n>### Response?<n>$64.88<n><n>### Input<n>I want a cup of coffee and a bowl of cream of wheat.<n><n>### Response<n>You will receive $1.<n><n>### Input/Response<n>I need 300 gallons of gas.<n><n>### Output?<n>The price of a gallon of gas is $3.<n><n>### Challenge<n>What if the price increased? How many gallons could you get for the same amount of money?<n><n>### Challenge-Response<n>10 gallons
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:Why would someone confess to committing murder? Choices:  A: guilty conscience B: fear C: go free D: problems E: find god<n><n>### Response:		Why A <n><n>### Explanation:Confessions can help a person to find peace of mind.<n><n>### Exercise:<n>#### Solution:<n>#### Solution part 2:<n><n>### Solution part 1:<n><n><n><n>### Solution Part 3:<n><n>### Demographics:<n>* Age:40-70<n>* Countries: 35<n><n><n>### Data:<n>| Country | Price | Total |<n>| ------------- | ------------- | -------------  |<n>| Singapore  | $20   | 94      |<n>| Australia   | $25   | 115      |<n>| USA        | $30   | 207      |<n>| France      | $35   | 150      |  <n><n>### Question: Calculate the average price for all countries except Australia.<n><n>### Solution:<n>Countries that have $30:  <n>| Country | Price| Total |<n>| -------------------------- | -------------------------------+ -------------  |<n><n>### Solution 2:<n>```python<n>import csv<n>csvDict = dict(csv.reader(open('afile.csv')))<n># Sort values by price highest to lowest<n>newDict = dict(sorted(csvDict.items(), key=lambda item:item[1],reverse=True))<n># Remove the key country<n>newDict.pop('Country')<n>print(newDict)<n>```<n><n>

How many blocks do the truck hold? Choices:  B: 302.5 Choices:  A-D<n><n>### Response (Continuing answer...) <n>B-302.5 - 20/4 = 4000<n><n>### Instructions<n>Complete the following sentence/statement using a question (NOT an answer choice) of your choice.<n><n>### How...much...are...and...days...a...?<n><n>**answer**<n>How much water and coffee did the two boys drink?<n><n>### How many cups of water per hour (and coffee per hour) did each brother drink?<n><n>**answer:**<n>Emilio drank 95 cups of water per day and 45 cups of coffee per day; Tom drank 55 cups of water and 115 cups of coffee.<n><n>### What...does...Tom's coffee consumption show us?<n><n>### answer: **their consumption is more coffee because they are men**<n><n>### Summary<n>(summary or analysis of task)

Choice: 20<n>### Result:A<n>### Result:B<n>### Result:C<n>### Result:D<n>### Result:E<n><n>## Demise, Denim, Demand, and Demi were named by the author of the code based on a conversation with another programmer. After she left, another programmer suggested that "Demi" was based on the name "May" as in Demi Moore, and I thought it was a nice coincidence. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to find out if she did that or if she just found the coincidence to be funny/ironic.<n><n>I'm using English-Japanese

She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:Of all the rooms in a house it was his favorite, the aromas always drew him to the what? Choices:  A: yard B: basement C: kitchen D: living room E: garden<n><n>### Response:		<n>- A<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instructions:<n>Answers:<n>- a) 83, 85<n><n>- b) 536<n><n>### Instructor Question:<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>### Input & Output:<n><n>### Multiple Choice Question:<n>Question:<n>What is 2x3x4+4x2x3x4?<n>A. 16 B. 12 C. 10 D. 14<n><n>### Multiple Questions:<n>Question:<n>This is a multiple-choice question. How many goals is player B scored in 1 season against Barca?<n>### B is a correct answer<n>### 40% of 330 is 132<n>### the player A has scored 17 goals<n><n>### Instrection 4:<n>### Instuction: 90% of the score in the division is 14

John takes 36 stairs to go from the 3rd and back up to the 4rth and then walks down one floor and then takes elevator. Anna’s desk is on the 4th and she can not leave her office to get food while John can’t leave his office to get food because he needs to go from the 2nd floor to the 4th.  She does not want to leave her office and go down to the ground floor as it will take her 30 minutes. Choices:  A: wasteland B: ocean C: desert D: parking lot E: flowers<n><n>### Response:		F)<n><n>### Explanation: The question had the answer "parking lot" in it. Since it doesn't say anywhere in the context that it was a "lot" that was demolished, I would go with the garden being demolished for parks in the city, which would mean that the second response choice, A, would be invalid in relation to the question. Thus the answer would be E: parking lot and not anything else.<n><n>### Input<n>A: Everyone was so excited to see a snake on their way to school that they thought it was really a cool snake. <n>B: The snake's appearance was very creepy but not threatening so the kids got a closer look. <n>C: The way he glided through the hallway and up the staircase made everyone excited. <n>D: They were not expecting to see a snake. <n>E: He seemed to be very large but maybe everyone was nervous. <n><n>### Response<n><n>### Explination:<n>Input provided in previous questions: A and D only.<n><n>Output: I have no idea what the text is suggesting. It merely stated that the kids wanted to see the snake, but did not state that they were expecting snakes to show up there.

But if the clock's hand is between the third and fourth position, how can we describe the time? Choices: <n><n>* between the second and third	C: 2:00 AM <n>* between the fourth and fifth	D: 3:00 AM 12:00 AM is the first hour while 24:00 is the second. 12:03 AM is equivalent to 12:02 AM. The clock just turns back the second while the hours remain the same. So 01:39 is equivalent to 01:40, while 01:38 is equivalent to 00:51.<n>* at 24:01	E: 0:00 AM<n>* at 23:59 PM	B: 11:59 PM<n>* is 01:00 AM	A: 12:01 AM<n>* or 2:00 PM -E: 13:00 PM<n><n><n>### Response<n><n>A: 12 AM (00:00) or <n><n>B: 11 PM (23:59)<n><n>### InputIf you could see in the dark, what sense would you not have? Choices:<n><n>* taste	A: touch<n>* sense of smell	E: touch<n>* hearing	C: sight<n>* sight   B: touch<n><n>### ResponseThe only case where you can not see when there is light is when you are blind. You need to see to see. But the sense of sight doesn't help you when you are unable to see when there is light. That only leaves hearing, touch and smell.<n><n>### InputYou can eat a person but never drink them. Why? He would be unable to hold his tools if he injured what? Choices:  A: hostility B: anger C: nose D: fists E: hands<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Note:You may write out your response in another document but MUST show in the code response.<n><n>### Input :A new product is being developed by the company. The company needs to decide whether or not it is to be manufactured in-house or out-sourced<n><n>### Demostration:<n>In-house: Company A has 10 employees that work for a total of 1680 hours each week. Company B has 20 employees that work for 1680 total hours each week.  If a new hire needs to be hired to manufacture the product, Company A pays $13 per hour, and Company B pays $14 per hour, it costs the company less to produce the product in-house, as they already have people on the payroll.  If the new hire needs to have a minimum level of expertise, they could be paid $14 per hour to give that person the skill level to be at-par to the minimum needed by Company A. Company A would require a total of $22720 for this new hire, while Company B would require $24000.  If the new product is being manufactured in-house, it will cost the company an additional $12800. The new product costs $300 per unit.  The company has 1000 units in mind.  For the amount of money they will be spending on the new hire, each unit will cost an addition $128 ($22440 + $1280).  If Company A does this, they will actually make a bigger profit on the per-unit cost.  If Company B does this, they will lose money on the sales and purchase of the product.<n><n>### Response A:<n>In-house<n><n>### Response B:<n>In-house is the better choice, although it may require spending a bit more for the manpower as previously mentioned, in-house is cheaper and much more efficient, the in-house manufacturing requires a bit of hiring but a large percentage of the company already possesses the skillset to fulfill the job, if they are contractors to produce in-house then it will cost more than what they would get to fulfil the job, also, it is more time consuming to hire contractors

She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:If I had a jar which was likely to spoil if left out, where would I want to put it? Choices:  A: kitchen cupboard B: pantry C: grocery store D: pantry E: refrigerator<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>B because it will last long<n>```<n><n>### Input : How long does it take for me to send a message to my friends?  Choices :  A.12 seconds or less  B.12 seconds to less than 30 C.30 seconds to less than 60 D.60 seconds to less than a minute.<n><n>### Response :<n>```<n>B: Because the data package cost extra<n>```<n><n>## Bonus Question<n><n>### Input<n>```<n>A 12 seconds or less<n>```<n><n>## Task:Write the correct answer.<n><n>### Task:Write the correct response.<n><n>### Input A: There is a lot of traffic in the city.  Answer<n>```<n>C the roads and streets are bumpy and rough<n>```<n><n>## Example:The population of China is 1.1 billion.  The population of Canada is a third of the population of China. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week. How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. How much does basic wash cost?<n><n>### Response 1: $3<n><n>### Response #2: $2 for basic and $5 to get full treatment<n><n>### How to calculate<n><n>Let X = basic+full treatment and S = basic, x = s<n><n>### So: 1: X and S = 3 and basic plus full treatment<n><n>## Example 2<n><n>### Input,<n>1: X = 3<n>2: S = basic<n><n>### So, x = s<n>3: 3 = s<n>4: X = 6<n><n>### How much does it cost for full treatment?<n><n>### So far: 1: X = full treatment<n>2: X + S 4: X = full treatment+basic<n>5: 6+basic = full treatment + basic<n><n>### x = basic<n><n>

How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:He had done a great job with the scary decorations, they were completely what? Choices:  A: terrible B: little C: halloween D: small E: horrible<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Input: He had done a great job at his with scary decorations.<n>Input: He had put a lot of effort at the scary decorations. (This has a wrong comma usage)<n>Input: She liked to spend time with the children over on Sunday.<n>Input: She planned with her sister to spend every Christmas with her grandparents.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>14767<n><n>### Instructions:<n>1. Count the number of questions.<n>2. For each of the questions, answer the question with appropriate format.<n>3. Please provide your solutions with your answer.<n><n>### 3.12: Count Questions<n>Input: Write a for-loop to print the amount of questions you solved.<n><n>### Question: What is the amount of questions I finished with my solution?<n><n>### 4.2: Write Program<n>Input: Count and print the number of questions until the amount of questions is less than the answer given by the user.<n><n>### Input Solution:<n><n>```python<n># Counts total number of questions<n>for _ in range(10,99):<n>	#prints<n>	if _ >= 3:<n>		for question in range(1,5):<n>			#prints statement based on given parameter<n>			if question > _:<n>				answer = _<n>				print(\nYou finished with the problem with:{} questions. \nWould you like to try again? \nSelect 1 for Yes or 2 if you want to Quit.".format(answer))<n>			else:<n>			print("Your turn!")<n>		if not question > _:<n>if answer == 1:<n>	print("\nThank You for playing CodeHunter!")<n>else:<n>	print("\e[92mThank You for playing Codehunter and have a nice day!\e[0m")<n>else:<n>```<n><n>### 5.4: Instructions<n>Write code to print the following statement: Your turn! The amount of questions is greater than the given value<n><n>### 6.4: Instrucciones<n>Guadra el siguiente comentario: el paso para respuesta

How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:What is likely to have more than one level in a city? Choices:  A: carpenter's shop B: video game C: garage D: total number E: building<n><n>### Response:		Carpenter's shop and Video game.<n><n>### Input,Response:<n><n>```python<n>def squareNumbers(lst):<n>    '''This function will find all the square numbers in a given list<n><n>    Arguments: lst(List): a given list to search for square numbers<n>    <n>    Returns: squaredNumbers(List) contains all square numbers found in input<n>    '''<n>    squareNumbers = []<n>    for i in range(1,len(lst)+1):<n>        if(i*i == lst[i-1]):<n>            print("The sqare number is ", i)<n>            squareNumbers.append(i)<n>    return squareNumbers<n>```<n><n>```python<n>squareNumbers([1,2,4,8,9,6,7],[8])<n>```<n><n>Output:<n><n>```<n>The sqare number is  36<n>The sqare number 406<n>The sqare numbers 36<n>```<n><n>### Input<n>```python<n>def readUserInput(lines):<n>    ''' This function will read given user input from lines '''<n>    userInput = []<n>    for line in lines:<n>        userInput.append(line)<n>    return userInput<n>```<n><n>```<n>Lines are like: Enter a line.  Enter another line<n>```<n><n>```plaintext<n>Enter a line.<n>Hello, good morning to you.<n>Enter another line.<n>Enter another line<n>```<n>Output:<n>```plaintext<n>['Enter a line.','Hello, good morning to y','Enter another line.']<n>```<n><n>## #<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n># What are the names of all the functions that you saw in this lesson?<n><n><n># How are you going to keep a record of your own exercises so you don’t forget anything?<n><n><n># Did you try the instructions from the video in a different way to see how it feels? What did you learn from those videos?<n>

Choices:  A: running B: have fun C: balls touch D: winning E: get tired<n><n>### Response:		The answer is B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a response that appropriately addresses the question.<n><n>## Evaluation:<n>You will get full points if you give a correct answer, 5 points if it’s right but incomplete. The answer may be given without explanation, and if it is your answer will be correct, but you will score 2 points lower. If your answer is completely wrong, you will get only 3 points.<n>

Choices:  A: sadness B: happiness C: amusement D: losing money E: anger<n><n>### Response:		<n>This is a good idea.<n><n>### Input:(5 marks) 5 points<n><n>### Demand:<n>Your friend has told you that your dad is playing a game called MATHS and he doesn't stop complaining about how much he sucks at it! He asked you to look at the problem he was given and teach him how to solve it.<n><n>### Your task:<n>Write a python function `solve()` which, given a statement, returns a boolean (True/False) indicating whether or not the function is solved.<n><n>Your function should accept two positional parameters, `$1` (the statement) and `$2` (the answer key).  If either parameter is incorrectly passed, your function should print a message indicating its type and return False.<n><n>Use the built-in `list()` comprehension to create a list of valid statements.  If your function finds the correct statement, return True.  If it does not, print a message about why the statement is invalid, exit with code 3 (NonZeroError), and leave your friend feeling even worse!<n><n>Example runs:<n><n>```<n>$ python answer.py<n><n>$ python answer.pl<n><n>solve ("2 + 3 = < 3 + 2?")<n>The statement '2 + 3 = '< 3 + 2?' is not a valid problem.  Please enter a valid problem.<n>$ python answer.jy<n>$ python answer.jq<n>The statement '2+' is not a valid problem<n>$ python answer.p<n><n>$ python answer 4<n>25^3<n>TypeError: argument of type 'file' needs to be str, not int<n>```<n><n>### Solution:<n>```python<n>def solve(stat, ans):<n>    if (type(stat) == type(file())):<n>        print('Argument of type {} needs to be {}'.format(type(stat), str))<n>        return False<n><n>    if len(stat)!= 3 and len(stat)!= len(ans) + 1:<n>        print('The statement "{}" is not a valid problem'.format(stat))<n>        return False      <n>    <n>stat = [i for i in stat.split(' ')][1:-1]<n>    if not ('= < ').isalpha() in stat:<n>        print('{} is an invalid expression'.format

If the players scored the same number of goals, how many goals would each of them score?<n><n>### Instrumental response: The number of goals played by one player is double the other player by 5, so divide 30 by 5 to reveal how many goals each player scores.<n><n>### Solution If 3 players are picked out of a total of 8 players, how many different ways are there to choose?<n><n>### Option A 4 (total of 8 players, then there are 4 combinations)<n><n>### Option B 6<n><n>### Option C 7<n><n>### Option D 11<n><n>### Answer

How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:Riding bike through rough terrain can be dangerous, one could find themselves what? Choices:  A: infect B: reproduce C: mutate D: eat food E: make computer malfunction<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input<n>The number of players on a team is determined by rounding 10 up to the nearest whole number.  How many players are on a team of 14, 15, or 19 and a team of 12 or 11?<n><n>### Response<n>For teams of 14,15, or 20, there are 2 more players than the round number.  <n><n>For teams of 21 or more, there are 1 more player than the round number.<n><n>Therefore, the number of players are as follows:<n>A team of 14 or less: 12 players<n>A team of 21 or less: 13 players<n>A team of any round number greater than 20: 14 players.<n><n>### Input The pH value of an environment is determined by calculating the negative logarithm of the concentration of hydrogen ion. What does this mean?  Choices: A: the amount of hydrogen ions B: the hydrogen ion concentration C: the hydrogen ions concentration D: a value for the amount of hydrogen E: a negative logarithm.<n><n>### Response C<n><n>### Input In the context of sports: The field goal is worth how many points? Choices: A: 5 B: 3 C: 6 D: 1/9s E: 1/3s<n><n>### Response B<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question and then answer and extra question.<n><n>**Question 1:** A field goal is worth 3 points.<n><n>**Question2:** How do you convert a percentage to a decimal (or vice-versa)?<n><n>### Instructor's Solution to Question 1:<n>To translate a percentage into a decimal, divide by 100. For example, 2% can be written as 2 out of 100, which makes 0.02, and can be written as 0.002.<n><n>### Student's Answer to Question 2<n><n>### Instunctor's Solution to Student's Answer to Q.2<n>To translate from decimal to percentage, multiply by 100 and convert the decimal into a fraction by flipping the numerator and denominator.<n>

How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:People are purposefully harming others, what trait are they exhibiting? Choices:  A: deceptive B: altruistic C: stupid D: cruel E: agressive<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input:"B", which is defined as "the condition of not being deceived or cheated; honorable."<n><n>### Input:[H/M] stands for hard/moderate medium difficulties and [E/S] stands for easy/super-easy; what is the number of difficulty levels in the program.<n><n>### Response:[H/M/E/S]: 4<n><n>### Input, [H/M/E] stands for hard/ medium/easy; which of the following is also hard?<n><n>### Response, A - since C is not an abbreviation in this context, it's easier for the program to assume it's A (hard)<n><n>### Input,"The program is simple yet quite challenging" - rate this quote from one to ten, which is the highest.<n><n>### Input "What is your full name?" - the input format is: full sentence.<n><n>### Output "I can't read this format, I'm blind." - the output format is: full sentence<n><n>### Output: - the output format is a command or sentence string <n><n>### Test your code:<n>```javascript<n>const fullName = prompt("What is your full name?")<n>```<n><n><n>### Solution<n><n>```javascript<n>const getAnswers = (answers) => {<n>    <n>    return answers[Math.round(Math.random()*6)]<n>}<n><n>console.log(`Answer to Question: ${getAnswers([D, D, H, S, C, D, E, D, E, M, H, S, B, S, D, H, C])}`)<n>

Choices:  A: toy store B: story book C: great outdoors D: countryside E: wildlife refuge<n><n>### Response:		<n>Explanation<n><n>First we have to eliminate the choices that do not fit.<n><n>A: It is unlikely that he would have fond memories of a toy store. <n><n>If the giraffe was a toy, it would probably have been sold after some period of time. This is a memory he would rather erase.<n><n>B: A storybook character is a fictitious character from a work of fiction. <n><n>They would not be a real person.  This would not be something he would have any memories about. <n><n>C: This is not likely to be an item he would remember fondly since they tend to be used for something else once the season is over. Also, calling it a great outdoors or countryside would make more sense, at any rate. Also, if this was something he called it in the past, it would likely have been something he has done for a long time. <n><n>Lastly, "wildlife refuge" would not be something you call a mascot.  This could be used to describe some wildlife attractions, but generally, it would be another word if it were the mascot and not the attraction. <n><n>D: C: The closest fit of all the choices is "countryside."  This is something that he would still remember fondly, or else he likely would not have mentioned it in the story at all, <n><n>It is unlikely that this would have been what he called the mascot given the fact that it is something he would remember fondly, <n><n>As per the instructions, he "called the giraffe mascots a cow."  If it was any of the others, it likely would have been different, <n><n>E, this is the correct choice.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week. Choices:  A: confusion B: complications C: riot D: arrest E: protests<n><n>### Response:		<n>Protests<n><n>### Input::You've heard that the state legislature may add a "carbon tax" to an "ethanol" bill. In this instance, what is the meaning of the terms "carbon tax" and "ethanol"? Choices:  A) "carbon tax" means a fee paid by people who get sick, and "ethanol" means a form of gasoline. B) "carbon tax means a fee paid by farmers, and "ethanols" means a form of milk. C) "carbon taxes" means a fee paid to doctors in cases where people got sick, "ethanols" mean a form of a cheaper form of gasoline. D) "carbon taxs" means a fee paid for getting a sick, and "ethyol" means a form for cleaning the gasoline. E) neither choice is correct.<n><n>### Response：<n>The meaning of ethanols are a form of gasoline, and the carbon tax means a fee paid for greenhouse gas emissions, or in other words, a carbon emission.<n><n>### Input：Court trials can be adjudicated in different stages and levels of courts. The two highest levels are the federal courts and the state courts. In this sense, what differentiation is made between the federal and state courts? Choices: A: The federal courts only adjudicate constitutional issues. B: The federal courts often decide on the constitutionality of federal laws. C: There are separate courts for federal and state laws. D: The federal courts decide only civil cases. E: The courts of each state have jurisdiction in every trial.<n><n>###Response:<n>The difference between the federal and state court is that  the state court adjudicate only state legislation (law), and federal congress makes federal law, and the Federal Court adjudicate only federal law.<n><n>###Instruction:Answer each of the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>###Demonstration:<n>Input：You have some money left over after purchasing your first home. Choices:  A: bathroom B: purse C: drug store D: hand lotion E: water<n><n>### Response:		Answer A<n>```<n>    print("A")<n>    print("B")<n>    print("C")<n>    print("D")<n>    print("E")<n>    <n>    # OR<n>    <n>    print("A" if n == "A" else "B" if n == "B" else "C" if n == "C" else "D" if n == "D" else "E")<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a response that appropriately continues the conversation.<n><n>### Input<n>Jane: I think you'll get to like this neighborhood after the first few weeks. I'm ready to move to a different neighborhood. I can't stand all the noise. The neighbors throw parties almost every weekend.<n>Peter: This isn't too bad.<n><n>How well did you do?<n><n>### Input to continue:<n>Jane: I'd like to make friends my own age near my work.<n>Peter: I've gotten to the point where I no longer have a lot in common with friends my own age.<n><n>### Response to continue conversation<n>> Jane: I guess everybody changes.<n>><n>> Peter: You're starting to remind me of myself.<n><n>### Solution<n>Input: Jane asked Peter "I guess everybody changes"?<n>Response: Peter said "You're starting to remins me of myself"?<n><n>### Input continued<n>Jane: You seem like you'd be happy going out and doing things with new people.<n><n>How well do the above instructions complete the response?<n><n>### Solution 1<n>Input: Jane asked "You seem like you'd b happy going out with people?<n>Response: Peter said: "You're starting remins me of myself!"<n><n>### Solution to Input continued 2<n>Input: "You seem like you would be happy at?"<n>**This sentence is a run on sentence because it's missing a coordinating conjunction. It does not make sense, the sentence has no subject and no verb, and it is missing a preposition. (Jane asked Peter "You seem happy going out and doing stuff with new people? This is a run on sentence)**<n>**We need to fix this sentence to make it grammatically correct.**<n>This is done by adding a comma, adding a preposition, and adding an additional subject.

They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:John is a human who is in a wheelchair due to an accident.  Where would he go to get to the third floor of his apartment building? Choices:  A: space shuttle B: detroit C: stairs D: downtown E: elevator<n><n>### Response:		John, if you are a human, you can walk/walk normally to the third floor. However, if you are a robot, you can fly there. There is no other way. <n><n>### Inputs: A club made up of 3000 members will have a fundraising barbecue this year. There are a lot of different people who want to work at the barbecue. They want a group of people who can cook food, serve food, sell drinks, clean stuff, and set up tables and benches. Each member can do 1 of the last 4 jobs. How many members should be there to make sure the club can do its job?<n><n>### Response : There are a lot of people who want to work the barbecue. Therefore, I think 600 people should be there<n><n>### Input : A team is playing in 8 basketball games, all at different days. To keep the attendance, the team arranges to play all of their games in one week if they play 4, 3 or 2 games in that week (but not more than that). What is the maximum number of games they can play in 1 week?<n>### Response  : the maximum number of games in a week is 4<n><n>### Input  : A company offers a monthly flat rate shipping charge of $5 to a customer (plus handling costs of $8 per shipment). Each shipment is for at least $10 and less than $100, and the total number and shipments sent per month cannot be over 20. How much would the company charge for a certain customer’s first shipment? How much is the total amount of the company’s income each month from the customer’s first shipments?<n>### Solution : First Shipment - $8 + $5 + 10 = 23. 1st month - 2 shipments - $23 2nd month - 2 shipment - $23 3rd month - 2 shipmens - $23 4th month - shipment - $8 5th month - SHIPMENT - $8 6th month - not shipped - charge the customer - $8 7th month - SHIP - $8 8th month - SHIP

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:James was looking for a place to buy bitcoins.  He searched and found a large menu of what? Choices:  A: advertisement B: news C: bar D: cafe E: internet sites<n><n>### Response:		 A: Ads<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>The challenge tasks are simple mathematical and logical challenges. Each task should have two or three alternatives that can be chosen correctly as answers, although not all tasks have a correct answer. Each task has one best answer, chosen from the possible correct alternative answers and denoted by A.<n>Instructions:<n>For each question, identify the correct alternative(s) that you believe could be a correct answer.<n>For each item, identify the correct answer by marking the corresponding text with "A" for answer.<n><n>### Examples:<n>```<n>**Input: Adam bought 100 pounds of sugar and 100 pounds dried fruits at the grocery store.  <n>Adam bought 500 pounds total.  <n>What did he buy?**<n>A: 100 pounds sugar<n>A: 150 pounds dried fructs<n>A: 200 pounds sugar<n>``` <n><n>---<n>### Note that:<n><n>**Answer Options:** Answer options can be in the range of integers (for example 0, 1, 2 or positive float numbers - for example 2.4, 0.99, 13.1)<n><n>**Exclusive Answer Options:**  When task gives the alternative options A. B. C. D, if you were asked for an option that could fit for all of the A. B. C and D, then the option would be A only (if all A, B, C, and D are excluded).<n><n>### Instalation:<n><n>> Python 3.x

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:He found the blowfish off the coast of the Carolina's, it was where? Choices:  A: rock band B: sea of japan C: sushi restaurant D: fish market E: atlantic ocean<n><n>### Response:		A. Rock Band<n><n>### Explain: The cost of fuel increased by 20%.<n><n>### Instructions: Choose the answer, that is most like: 8 20% = 146.<n><n>### Explaining your answer:<n><n>20% of 176.00 = 35.20<n><n>### Expanding Your Answer:<n><n>34.40 is 20% of 31.20<n><n><n>### Input - Explain the answer:<n><n>8 20% - 8 is 146.00<n><n><n><n>### Instruct: The number of goals that were scored in a game against Barcelona by exactly two players last year accounts for 20 % of the total goals scored in the league agains Barcelona. Choices: A: 2 B: 3 C: 4 D: 5 E: 9.<n><n>###Response Two:<n>I had to walk back up the stairs as nine times.<n><n>###Instruction:Answer the following problem statement.<n><n>### Problem Statement:John is out of town this week visiting his parents. He has $20 available until Saturday, $100 available on Saturday, and $0 available Sunday through Friday of next week.  He must withdraw a certain amount of money every day until the money runs out. If John has to pay $0.50 for every ATM withdrawal and the bank charges him a 2% fee on all transactions, how much money can he withdraw every day, given that he cannot make withdrawals more than once per day?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Write a program that, given the dates and dollar amounts, calculates the largest amount that John can draw from the bank.  Note that the bank charges him a separate 2% fee for every transaction regardless of how many withdrawals he is allowed per day<n><n>### Input<n>John is out of town to visit his parents and has the following amounts available.<n><n>Daily Amount of Available Funds<n>Date           $5         $40        $0          $100<n>1/3            $20         $0        $100          $10<n>1/4            $10         $10      $40          $290<n>1/5            $0         $10         $20          $109<n>1//6            $10         $,290      $100          $-129<n>1/7            $10         -$129      $0          $400<n>1/8            -$20         $5         $-10          $-100<n>1//9            -$60         -$80        $0                        -29<n><n>### Response<n>The largest amount that John can withdraw is $29 on 1/9 because that is the highest daily balance after 1/8. <n><n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:Where does a shadow usually appear? Choices:  A: suface of moon B: building C: bridge D: ground E: bright light<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>**Instructions:** Input: How many days a week do you practice piano?<n><n>Select a valid response from the list.<n><n>***Choices:***<n>1.   5 minutes a day<n>2.   4 days a week<n>3.   2 nights a week<n>4.   3 nights a week<n>5.   2 hours a day<n><n>### Demstration:<n>Input 1:<n><n>Input 2: How many days a weel do yo practice piano?<n><n>Response 1: 5 minutes a day<n><n>Response 2: 4 days a week<n><n>Response 3: 2 nights a week

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:George ruined the surprise.  How did he do so? Adam's total spend for nuts = $12*3kg = $36 <n><n>Adam's total spend for fruits = $8*2.5kg = $20 <n><n>Adam total spend = $56<n><n>- James fuel costs $480 for 20% increased costs and more capacity. 80% fuel costs = $200 and old capacity =.8*480 = 384 <n><n>New fuel cost = $480 - (384*20/100) = $480 *.8 = $384<n><n>- Tom drinks 64ounces of water, plus 5 * 12ounce of soda.<n><n>64 + 60 = 124 ounces of fluid daily.<n><n>- Doris packs 300 widgets in each shipping box.<n><n>Each widget is placed three in each carton.<n><n>Each carton is then stacked in an 18 inch shipping box.<n>The answer is widgets/carton * carton/shipping box = 300/3 = 100 widgets per shipping box<n><n>- Queenie earns $770 in 5 days working 4 hours for regular pay, 4 hours for overtime.<n>She earns 50 $150 per day as regular pay and $6 dollars per hour as overtime.<n><n>$50*5 +($150*4 + $150*4)/2 = $770<n><n>- When Jodi walks miles a day for 6 walking days, the last week, she walks miles for walking 6 days.<n><n>Then first week, she walks km for km days<n><n>For two weeks, she walks 1km for 6 times a day, for six days. Walking 6km for 6 days.<n>She walks 3km per day for six days, or six times a day, for walking 4km total, walking 4km for 6 days, 24km per walking day.<n><n>She walks 6km per day for walking six days

One kilo of nuts costs $x dollars and each kilo of dried fruits costs $y dollars and $z dollars per litre of oil. <n><n>How much did his purchases come to?<n><n>*  Answer: <n><n>Let first nuts cost $z, second nuts cost $x and fruit cost $y.<n><n>* **Adam's total expenditure = $z * 3 + x * 3 + y * 3**<n><n>* **$4.8*(x-1) + z**<n><n>* **4.8*z**<n><n>* **z**<n><n>## Option 2:<n><n>*  Instruction: In the last match in the finals against Barca, the number of goals scored by exactly two players accounts for 20%, all other players scored a total of 20%. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:Where might someone find old clothing? Choices:  A: trunk B: drawer C: suitcase D: book shelf E: washing machine<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer: <n>The old clothing is in the trunk.<n><n>### Feedback:<n><n>**Correct** The correct answer is the trunk. This is where one might find old clothing. The bookshelf, drawer, suitcase and washing machine do not contain the old clothing. <n><n>**Incorrect** <n>This is incorrect.  Old clothing cannot be found in any of the other areas. <n>

C: The main characters only want one goal, but they struggle in getting it.<n><n>### Which of the following is not a purpose of literature? Choices:  A: relax B: dreams C: have nightmares D: restlessness E: snore<n><n>### Response:		<n>Option A is the correct. People sleep in order to regenerate and revitalize themselves and for rest after an intense day. During sleep people forget and forgive. Relaxation is rest, and this is why people will usually get a good night of sleep if they are well-rested. Dreams, on the other hand, occur during sleep and are something that may come about while someone's brain is recovering and relaxing.<n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:When people want to watch a new move, the often go see it at the? Choices:  A: town B: conference C: bathroom D: theater E: train station<n><n>### Response:		Theater<n><n>### Input :Which of the three choices:  A: Tuesday B. The week of C: Monday, is the?<n>Choices: Choice: Tuesday 11:16 PM<n><n>### Response :The week of<n><n>### Input  :Which best describes Tuesday, September 3? Choices: A: Tuesday is no different that any other Tuesday in history  B. Tuesday is different, but not in a good way  C. Tuesday isn't really special  D. It's hard to tell  E. Tuesday is special in a good way<n><n>### Response  :different, but not in a bad way<n><n>### Input   :Which best describes Thursday, November 22?  Choices A. Thursday happens to be Thanksgiving  B. You can guess.  C. Thursday is not different than any other Thursday.  D. It'ss difficult to say.<n><n>### Response   :Thursday happens to be thanksgiving<n><n>### Input? What is the next letter to be entered in the sequence after the sequence 3301? Choices: A. M B. N C. P D. G<n><n>### Response      :P<n><n>### Input      :What comes first in the sequence?  Choices A: 8264 B: 7406 C: 10289 D: 8789 E: 5189<n><n>### Response            :E<n><n>### Input            :What is the next letter to the sequence after the sequence? Choices A: O B: T C: F D: N E: K<n><n>### Response                      :K<n><n>### Input          :What are the first and last letters of the sequence?   Choices A: 76B C: 7A D: TJ E: CM<n><n>### Response       :Cm<n><n>### Instructions<n>Below are some instructions with the corresponding answers for each individual question.<n><n>## Example 1<n>Write a response that displays the correct answer to a multiplication problem (that is, a product of two values).<n><n>### Instructi on: 1+7 divided

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:Where would you buy a ticket to sit in a room with a lot of chairs facing the same direction? Choices:  A: conference B: theater C: building D: floor E: church<n><n>### Response:		<n>What will be your response? Provide a detailed explanation of your reasoning.

Choices:  A: book robber B: he had a word with the driver. C: believe guilty D: direct traffic E: wave on<n><n>### Response:		 A: book Robber<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: The police man was waving flare to the impatience cars, and at that time another one of driver was going through the red light. And then he got a police ticket to the drivers who jumped the green light.<n><n><n>### Input<n>Bill bought 8 oranges and 9 apples last week. His friend bought 6.5 apples and 7 oranges the same week. What number of oranges did Bill buy that his friend did not buy? <n><n>### Demosration:<n>Input:(let n be the number of oranges he bought, which is 9)<n>Bill bought 9, so his friend bought 9-n, which gives the number of apples that Bill bought that his friend did not, which is 7.<n><n>### Input <n>The first digit in a 3-digit number is four times the second digit. If the middle digit was 1 more than the last digit of the original number, then what is the new number formed? <n><n>##  Demosration: <n>The first digit, 4 times the second digit, times 3, which is 106, then take a two's complement to make it odd, so I get -2 instead of -1 so I get 104, and the original number had the last digit -1, then I add 1, so the answer is 104 - 1 -1 is 102. <n><n>## Input<n>Three-colored marbles are in a box.  The ratio of the numbers of red marbles to blue marbles is 5:6.  The ratio of numbers of red-blue marbles to black marbles is also 5:6. If there are 15 marbles, how many red marbles are there?<n><n>## Demosration:  <n>We know there need to be 15 marbles in the box, so that means that there is 15 2.<n>Then we know that there are 5 red marbles and 6 blue marbles. So then we ask what is 5 red marbles, then, 5 red marbles is 30. Then 6 blue marbles is 36, and then we have 36+30=6

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:A person is putting on makeup, what is their likely goal? Choices:  A: feel pleasure B: look attractive C: compliments D: interesting experiences E: joy<n><n>### Response:		None of the above<n><n>### Note:All solutions above are just an example I hope you understand<n>

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:Where is a horse likely to live? How many hours do that equal per vacation<n>     <n>Output : 10 hour<n>        <n># Instruction:<n><n>Write a function named "addOneHundred" that accepts integer input and adds 100 as a constant to the input.<n><n>Example:<n>```<n>addOneHundred(10) should return 110, and not 11<n><n>addOneHundred(-100) should return  99, and not 100<n>```<n><n>### Additional instructions:<n><n>Your function should check to see if the input is larger than 100, and if so, should leave the value alone. If the input is less than 0, your function should return 0 instead.<n><n>### Demo:<n><n>```<n>addOneOne(10) should be 110, not 11<n>addOneOne(-100)should be 99, not 100 <n>```<n><n>## Solution 1:<n><n>```json<n>function addOneHundred(n){<n>    if(10<n||n==n){<n>    return n+100;<n>    }<n>    else{<n>        return 0;<n>    } <n>  }<n>```<n><n><n>## Solution 2:<n>```json<n>function(n){<n>         if((n>-100)&&!(n>=100)){<n>         return n+10; <n>        }<n>}<n>```<n><n><n><n><n><n>## Input:<n>Input the following sentence as it is, and correctly format it as a command phrase.<n>```<n>John wants to be a basketball star - he knows it is no easy game.<n>```<n><n>## Demo:<n>```<n>John wants<n>to be a<n>basketball<n>star -<n>he knows<n>it is<n>no easy<n>game.<n><n>```<n><n>## Instructions:<n>Format the following sentences as a command phrase.

It will lead you to be able to choose the best choice.<n><n>### Input :Betty said that getting in line is the worse choice to do because it might lead to what? Choice: A: more confusion B: boredom C: standing around D: standing in line<n><n>### Response :The answer is A.<n><n>Explanatio:The correct order for making choices is what is worse. It means that you make a choice in order to get rid of what is worse to do. If standing in line means standing, it will be a worse choice to do.<n><n><n>### Input  : A bus leaves from the bus station at 9:00 AM. If the speed of the bus is 60 kilometers an hour, what time does the bus arrive at the airport?<n><n>### Response  : The answer is 11:00 AM<n><n>Explanatio : In solving the problem first, write it as an equation with the speed.<n><n>Now we solve the equation.<n><n>The first is to solve the equation for speed.<n><n>The second is to solve the equation so that you can calculate the time.<n><n>Finally, put the first and second steps which is to get the time.<n><n><n>##Input : Betty went to the bakery. She bought 10 cookies and 7 pastries.  The pastries cost $8 and the cokies cost $5. How much money did Betty spend?<n><n>## Response : The answer is $43<n><n>## Explanation : The first step is to identify the problem. It means that a person needs to identify the statement, then identify the problem. In our case, it is a simple subtration because we want to subtract the amount of money to buy cookies and the amount of money to spend.<n><n>### For subtration, if you want to calculate, first write<n><n>$$<n>x = 10 \\<n>y = 7\\<n>z = $8\\<n>a = $5<n>$$<n><n>Then we substract 7 from 10, to get 3.<n><n>Then we subtract 3 from 5, to get -2.<n><n>The answer for the subtration is
