On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:Always wash your hands before eating, you don't want to get germs onto food and inside your what? Choices:  A: water B: doctor C: spread disease D: mouth E: ear<n><n>### Response:		<n>Correct answer: water<n>### Input:How much money do I need for a $500 bicycle? Choices:  $0 A B $350 C $500 D $650 E $800<n><n>### Response<n>Correct answer: $500<n>### Instruction : In this exercise, you will be shown a table. The question will ask for two possible numbers to place in a cell in the table.<n><n><n>### Input<n><n>Example Input<n><n>+-------+-------+-------+<n>| |  A  |  B  |<n>+-------+-----+-----+<n>| 1   | 10  | 100 |<n>+-------+------+-----+<n>|2  -->  | 20 | 200 |<n>+----------+-----+-----+<n><n><n>### Output<n><n>Example Output<n><n>+-------+-------------+-------+<n>| Number | New Number? |  Final |<n>+-------+------------+-----+<n>| 3  -->  | Yes  | 7  |<n>+----------+--------+-----+<n><n>### Inquiry1:<n>How many times the new number is bigger than the current number<n><n>### Inqury2:<n>How many times is the new number bigger than the original number<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>1. Place the answer to each of the following questions (based on the provided answers) in the spaces indicated in the table above<n><n><details><n><summary>Click to expand solution</summary><n><blockquote class="notice--info" markdown="1"><n><n>```python<n>for row in range(2,5,2):<n>  number = row<n>  new_number = row//2<n>  new_numbers > current_number = new_number >= new_number<n><n>  print('For row ', row,<n>  '\nHow many times the new', new_number,<n>  '\nNumber is bigger than... ')<n><n><n>  print('the current number ', current_number)<n><n><n>```<n><n></blockquote><n></details><n>

Instructions: <n>A person has 11.5 kg of nails in total. 5 of them are 1.5 inches long and 1 kg of them are 2 inches long. Write an expression that represents the total number of 2-inch-long nails.<n><n>### Demo:<n>Expression: (11.5x2+5)  - 11.5x1+5<n>= (1.5x2 + 2x2) - (1.5x1 + 1x1)<n>= 11.5 + 11.5 - 3 + 2<n>= 27.05 nails<n><n>### Instriuctions:<n>3. Input:The number of goals scored in all games against Barcelona last season accounts for 63% of all goals scored. How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week. How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:Where is a bald eagle safe? Choices:  A: pine tree B: open country C: in washington D: wildlife refuge E: sky<n><n>### Response:		<n>B<n><n>### Instructions:Complete the following tasks.<n><n>### Task 1:Write a function that returns the smallest 3 number out of an array.<n>```javascript<n>function f(x)<n>    return x.splice(0, 3)[0]<n>```<n>This function takes in a random number 1-1000 as an input and splices the array of numbers returned by a random number down to only the first three numbers.<n><n>### Test case:Write the expected result of how it works with the following number array.<n>```javascript var x = [2, 1, 3, 4, 6, 3, 1] <n>f(x) //Output should be [3,1,4]*/ <n>```<n>### Sample input<n>```javascript var x1 = [1,2,0,5,10,7,8] ```<n>### Sample output<n>```javascript f(x1) // [3,3,6] ```<n><n>### Solution:<n>```javascript<n>function smallestthree(x) {<n>	return x.splice( 0, 3)[ 0 ]<n>}<n>```<n>### Task 2:Write a function that gives the smallest random number between 200 and 1000.<n>```javascript<n>var x1 = random(200,1000)<n>```<n>The input number is 1000-200=800 but the output comes out as 200.<n>```js<n> function smallest (){ <n>    (x1) =><n>    ({<n>        return x.splice(); <n>    })<n>}<n>```<n>This works similarly to the other question in that it spliced off the array before the three and returned it. <n><n>### Sample input:<n>```javascript<n>var xs1 =random(200, 1000) <n>```<n>## Sample Output:<n>```javascript smallest(x1)// outputs [1,2,3] ```<n>

On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:Where would you see people in uniform playing with a ball? Choices:  A: hole B: television C: sporting goods store D: pool table E: sporting event<n><n>### Response:		<n>C: sporting goods store<n><n>### Input:(A) John is a soccer coach in England. He has 26 players for his team. His team always has 2 sets of the same number of players of which one is a goalkeeper. Choose the number of sets of players.<n><n>1. A:3<n>2. B:5<n>3. C:8<n>4. D:1<n><n>### Response:(2)<n><n>### Input (B) You have a collection of three-dimensional shapes. You want to make one solid cube out of the shapes in the collection. How many different collections can you make?<n><n>### Response (2)<n><n>## Instruction<n>When writing the responses use full sentences and proper spelling to complete the task. How many students are there in the university <n><n>Answer: 5.45 + 3.00 = 8.45. therefore the answer must be 8.45 because 3 and 8 are not prime numbers<n>```<n><n>We give you sample answers to help you on how to answer questions. If the guess was accepted, output the message “You are correct”. Otherwise if the guess is too high or too low, output the message “That person is wrong”.<n><n>**Hints:**<n><n>1. If the number is in the range [1, 100] then the number is valid. Otherwise, the number is invalid.<n><n>2. You can start off by printing "Too low" or "Too high" if the guess is less <n>or more than 100 respectively. That would mean you can reduce your <n>guess range. Also use the modulus function, (a % b) to find out if a is in the <n>range [0, 100].<n><n>## INPUTS(text)<n><n>Hello! It's my 99th birthday and I need to get some new pep-cils! If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:What is a good result of losing weight? Choices:  A: increased energy B: healthier C: loose skin D: beauty E: death<n><n>### Response:		<n>D, the answer, is: death<n><n>```<n>Explanation:<n>Sadly, the answer given is incorrect.<n>To support the argument for death, the answer gives examples of beauty and health.<n>These are not good enough to override death as a possible good consequence.<n>However, the answer does say that death is a bad consequence.  A good result in losing weight does not include death as a possible response.<n>```

Choices A: 20 B: 30 C: 40 D: 50 E: 60 F: 70 G: 80<n><n>### Response :<n>D<n><n>## How to do better<n>- Write complete sentences<n>- Write meaningful responses<n>- Be detailed<n>- Use the correct words<n>- Respond to the task<n>  <n>## Resources<n>[Expert Reviews](https://youtu.be/1nEK_Rn4vxw)<n>[Codecademy]( https://www.codecademy.com/catalog/levels/beginner),<n>[Datacamp](https://www.datacamp.com/resources/beginners-guides/data-preprocessing),<n>[Coursera](https://www.coursera.org/learn/dsc-introduction-to-data-science-in-python)<n><n><n>

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:The new play was the go to performance of the year, all the crowds would stand and what? Choices:  A: admiration B: applaud C: make reservations D: experience E: sleep<n><n>### Response:		All the crowd would stand and admire because the play was the go to play of the year.<n><n>### Challenge:An employee of a bar makes $250 per week plus $2.50 per beer can. If he works for 48 hours a week how much money does he make in one week?<n>```<n>Note: You should submit two complete sentences, one for the instruction and one for the response.<n>```<n><n>### Suggested Solution:<n><n>In this exercise we have seen a request for completing an instruction.  <n><n>### Response<n>1. The new play was the go-to performance of the year.<n>  <n>2. The audience would stand and admire the play because it was the best performance everyone had seen.<n>  <n>### Challenge<n>1. The employee of the bar makes $252.5 a week.<n> <n> 2. The employee works 48 hours out an entire week which brings his income to $252.<n><n>### Sources:<n>1. Choices:  A: wage war B: fight enemy C: kill D: destroy enemy E: attacked his country<n><n>### Response:		<n>**Answer:** Choices: A, B, C and D are all bad decisions, because none of them is what the situation demands. F, on the other hand, is the right thing to do. If the president of a given country does not love his people/country, he should resign. We do not want any situation where the president declares war or plans to attack his country because as head of state he holds the power to wage and declare war and destroy people and country. F is also the correct decision because F means giving hope to the oppressed ones. F (I love my country and people) is the right message for the president to send a country or country under attack.<n><n>### Input:- A shop stocked with only vegetables and 26 carts full of vegetables needs employees to check out customers. It employs one employee full-time and hires one additional part-time employee to work when needed. During the next eight days, the full-time employee works four days full-time, six days part-time, and the part-time employee works two days. How many vegetables were purchased during this time?<n>- Answer: - 240<n><n>- Input: The President of the Football club decides to hold an auction to raise money for the club, he announces it and it becomes a hit with his fans, but after the auction the president of the football club is accused of defrauding his fans, how many items were auctioned?<n><n># Solution:- Input: Input is in the form of an array of number of 10<n>Input: 748, 896,....<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Output<n><n>### Solution<n><n># Solution :-<n><n>### Method - 1<n>Input:- <n>Input is in the form of a string in the console<n> <n>### Output:-<n>Output the words in the string <n><n>### SolutionMethod -1<n>  ### import sys<n>  ### import re<n>  ### a=sys.argv[1]<n>  ### print(a)<n>  ### output=[]<n>  ### for i in re.findall(r'\b[a-zA-Z]\b', a):<n>  ###     output.append(i)<n> <n>  ### print (output)<n>####

If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:Where do you put a new dining table? Choices:  A: cafeteria B: arranging papers C: in the park D: formal dining room E: house<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input : What time does the subway get to your stop? Choices A: after 11 PM B: 11 PM C: around 11 PM D: between 11 PM and 12 AM<n><n>### Response : B<n><n>### Input (a): If the price of gas goes up by.15 per liter and the gas tank is 50 liters, what will the amount you pay be?<n><n>### Response (b): 55<n><n>### Input(b) :If the price of a liter of gas increases by 20 cents and the amount you bought went up by 10 liters, what is your total cost?<n><n>### The final output will look like (a) answer (b) answer<n><n>### Note : The first question will be the input followed by another question and the answer, and then the second question and the answer.<n><n>### 12th question:<n><n>### Instructions: This is a new challenge! Given the following equations for 1 to 9, figure out their solutions. There will be exactly 2 solutions.<n>- The sum of 1,2,3 and 5 is a constant.<n>- The sum 3 plus 1 equals 2 more.<n><n>### <n><n>1. 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 = 10; 2. 3 + 5 = 8; 3. 1 + 6 + 7 + 8 = 21<n><n>How much was the house again? The price of the house is $100,000.

If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:An expressway can suffer from traffic, this traffic gets worse the closer you get to any what? Choices:  A: michigan B: map C: american city D: rest stops E: country<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Example:<n>Example: An expressway can suffer from<n>-------------------------------<n>-------------------------------<n>A. MI<n>-------------------------------<n>B. MAP<n>-------------------------------<n>C. AMERICAN<n>-------------------------------<n>D. REST STOPS<n>-------------------------------<n>E. COUNTRY<n><n>### Commentary:<n>The correct answer is ‘A: Michigan’<n><n>### Demanded Solution:<n>Example Solution: An expressway can<n>---------------------------------------<n>---------------------------------------<n><n>### Example Solution:<n>The expressway can suffer from the<n>---------------------------------------<n>traffic it gets worse the closer you<n>---------------------------------------<n>get to any of the state of Michigan<n>---------------------------------------<n>highway rest stops are located in the<n>---------------------------------------

Choices:  A: getting fat B: get fat C: typing words D: falling asleep E: wasted time<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input :<n><n>### Response : <n><n>**Example:** `Given the data for an array of the form:  <n>[ {height:[200,2,300]}, {height:['400','300','200']} ]`<n><n>#### What is the sum of all values with index 1?<n>Answer: 200   <n><n>#### What is all sum of all heights' values with an index of 0?<n>Answer: 900   <n><n>### Solution<n><n>#### Instruction:<n>Write a function named *sumValues(arr);* that takes any given array (with length) as input. It MUST return a sum of all heights with index 1.<n>#### Demonstration:In the example provided, the result should be 200, as it is the sum of all height values with index 1. (E.g. the value of each array in index 1 + the value of the height inside it's parenthesis).<n>#### Response:<n><n>__Method__:   <n>1. The function takes the array input which length is known in the beginning and creates a local array with length and stores it to a variable called *array;*.   <n>2. It iterate through *array* and adds each height with index 1 to the sum variable, and the last number to another variable *sumArr;*.   <n>3. Finally it return *sumArr*.<n><n>__Sample Input__:<n>```javascript<n><n>sumValues([{height: ['400', '500']}]);<n>```<n>__Sample Output__:<n>```javascript   <n>450<n>```<n>

On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:In the middle of the day what will someone do because of being hungry? How many children are in the school?<n><n>Answer: 98<n><n>### Instraction:You are building a car that takes a long time to run at 80 miles per hour, with a motor that starts at 2,000 RPM and a tire that moves you forward at a constant rate given by the speed, v, of the car. The distance, d, traveled per second depends on the car’s current RPM, the car’s current speed, and an algebraic function, f, that depends on both of these variables. The current RPM of the engine is found by solving this equation:<n><n>[![2,000 - 2.4 * e ** - t]({{ site.baseurl }}/assets/images/25.png)]({{ site.baseurl | append: "/assets/images/26.png" }})<n><n>### Response A: 80<n><n>### Instrutio:You are building a two stage rocket that can carry 200 pounds, but its fuel can be used at most 4 times. The mass of the rocket, fuse, and payload is constant. Stage I burns 6 cubic feet per second for 12.4 seconds, stage II burns 15 cubic feet per second until its fuel is exhausted. Find the rocket’s mass and its payload<n><n>### Response B: 101<n><n>### Insturction:You plant a square flower bed in your yard. It has one side that is 5 feet long, but the other three sides each have a length of a constant number. When you water the bed, the water flows in a straight line. You can also water the bed with a water hose. To water the bed with the hose, you fill it up and then spray it, setting the distance L that you can spray to a constant number. The water flowing out of the hose’s spray takes the same amount of time at any distance. How

She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:If done correctly grooming pet's nails generally does not cause this? Choices:  A: training B: satisfaction C: injury D: beauty E: late<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```<n>$ cat Answer.txt<n>Grooming is an essential aspect of keeping pets healthy, but it can also cause injuries or discomfort for animals if not done correctly. Grooming can be broken down into three steps: nail trimming, brushing, and bathing. During nail trimming, it's essential to cut the nail so that it doesn't go past the quick (the pink part of the nail which houses a blood vessel), as cutting too far can cause bleeding and infection. However, if done incorrectly, nail trimming can cause injuries like bleeding, bruising, or infection. Brushing removes debris and dead skin from the coat, helping prevent parasites and improving coat health. While bathing is generally not recommended for pets since it removes natural oils from their skin and coat, some animals require frequent bathing. Keeping these factors in mind, it's essential for pet owners to ensure they are taking proper measures to<n>```<n><n>### Input The question is asked below. Choices are C, B,C, E<n><n>Question:<n><n>The answer to the question is:<n><n>"C: Late" because pet grooming is a time-sensitive task that requires frequent attention to avoid discomfort or injury.<n><n>### Answer<n><n>```<n>$ tail -f Answer.txt<n>C: Late<n>```<n>

" for example..<n><n>you are asking your user to provide 2 values...Adams purchase of Nuts and the cost of Nuts..<n><n>Then add a value to get Adams total cost...<n><n>Then ask the User to provide 2 values..Baked Beans and the cost of Baked Beans to get total cost for Jamie..<n><n>This is not an easy solution at all..<n><n>Your only solution is to build this as 3 separate functions..<n><n>Inputs for each..<n><n>Nut cost $12..<n><n>Nut purchase 3xkg..<n><n>Baked bean cost $8..<n><n>Baked Bean purchase is 2.5 x kg<n><n>You can use a for loop to perform each calculation, then use a sum function to calculate total costs<n><n>Answer: The `while` loop in `int question1(void)` should read `while(true)`<n><n>Comment: this doesnt solve the problem at all<n><n>Comment: You need to put in the rest of the code before we can give any useful advice.

Choices:  A: exhilaration B: dismemberment C: spinal injuries D: getting wet E: splats<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question. There is a single correct choice.<n><n>### Your Answer:<n>A<n><n>### Reason:<n>You should always answer A.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>A comedian who makes an entree of a spinal cord would be in for a world of pain.<n><n>### Input and Response<n><n>### Instuction:<n><n>Your task is to write comments and explanations that can help a novice programmer learn to solve the task without a demonstration.<n><n>### Comment and Explanation:<n>The input shows us the amount of fuel and the price per gallon at which this fuel is being sold.<n><n>### Calculation:<n><n>The calculation is quite easy. All we have to know is the total amount of gallons purchased and the price. Multiply the price with the value of gallons purchased to get the sum you had to pay.<n><n>### Conclusion:<n><n>### Instraction:<n><n>Your task for this instruction is to provide feedback to the following person by giving a suggested solution or an explanation.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>Ask the person how much fuel the plane needs. Divide the total capacity of the tank by the capacity of the fuel, to give you the number of gallons. Subtract the initial amount to get the number of gallons which are needed. Multiply this number by the price to find the cost in dollars.<n><n>### Note:The explanation above suggests a way to give help to someone who asks you for help. It might seem pretty unhelpful to just say, "ask someone how much fuel the plane requires".<n>However, the explanation above shows that a solution to a problem requires more knowledge than the question. By providing just the required information, the problem might arise again.<n><n><n>

If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:what can years of playing tennis lead to? Choices:  A: tennis elbow B: proffesional player C: exercise D: victory E: becoming tired<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Input <n>Tom has 2 quarters, 2 dimes, and 6 nickels in his pocket. If he has $16 in pocket for purchases, how many quarters does he have in his pocket?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: <n>Answer: 2<n>### Input<n>A woman is going on vacation soon, and she can afford to buy either a purse or a hat, not both. Which will she choose?<n><n>### Answer<n>Hat, purse does not makes sense.<n><n>### Input<n>The cost of a computer plus the cost of an internet connection is 10 percent more than the cost of a mouse. If the cost of a laptop plus the cost of a mouse is $370, what is the cost of the mouse?<n><n>### Solution<n>Addition<n><n>\$10\%=10\%*\$370*(\$136+\$68)*10\%*(\$370+\$68)=\$136+\($27*9.9)*(\$370+9.9*\$68)\$=\$997\$.<n>### Input<n><n>The price of a toy for boys and girls is the same. The ratio of the number of girls to the number of boys who buy the toy is 3 to 5. If the cost of the toy for a girl is \$5 more than twice the cost for a boy, what is the cost for a girl if the cost of the toys is \$12?<n><n>### Demo<n><n>Input:<n>Answer:<n>60<n><n>### Demystification<n><n>\[5\times\$2+\$12=x \]<n><n>\[x=60\]<n><n>### Inputs<n>The cost of a package to Africa is \$890 less than 3 times the cost of shipping to Australia. Write a comment describing how you would respond to this question.<n><n>2. Write a comment describing the steps to finding the answer to this problem.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>1. This program is an illustration of how to perform simple arithmetic on integers to calculate an answer to a question.<n><n>2.. Steps to find the answer are:<n><n>2.1.. Get the first number to be multiplied or added. In this case, the number to be multiplied is `Adam`.<n><n>2.2.. Get the first number that will be multiplied or added to the first number. Note that the second number will always be an operator. In this case, since `+` is an operator, the second number to be multiplied to Adam is `5`.<n><n>2.3.. Get the second number. Note that the number will always be preceded by the operator that will be multiplied by the first 2 numbers in the formula to solve the given problem. In this case, `2.5` is the second number and it will be multiplied by `Adam` and `+`. This will give `(2.5*Adam)+`<n><n>2.4.. Get the number to be multipliy to that formula. It is in this case a number to solve the problem. This will be the `Price` in the problem, 56. <n><n>2.5.. Now solve the formula using the formula in step 2.5. This gives `25.56`.<n><n>3. Write a comment describing another question, and ask or answer the question. Be specific.<n><n>### Analysis:<n><n>This program is a one dimensional problem. It deals with an issue of multiplication or addition of integers. Choices:  A: dream dreams B: think critically C: cross road D: drink coffee E: drive a car<n><n>### Response:		<n>```javascript<n>if(e && a)<n><n>{<n>    console.log("Doing both answers, good!" + e);<n>}<n>else if (b && d)<n>{<n>    console.log("Doing both answer, bad" + b );<n>}<n>else if(c && c)<n>{<n>    if(c==="A")<n>    {<n>        console.log("Do not cross road!"+ c);<n>    }<n>    else if(c=="B")<n>    {<n><n>    }<n>}<n>else<n>{<n>    console  .log("The answer is (C)!")<n>}<n><n>```<n>*If A,B, and D were all picked but the driver drank coffee and ate food, the code would return a "Do not cross road" but this is because both "A" cross the road and "B" and "D" are driving, and "C"  does not cross the road, so the answer is C.<n><n>### Input : If the height of a stack of chairs is 20 chairs, and the top chair is twice as heavy as the bottom chair, what is the total weight of the stack?(Weight = n*m)<n><n>> The first chair is heaviest so we are going to start with 1 so n = 1.<n><n>*If the height of a stack is 20 chaires then the weight of the first chair is 20*1 and the total weight would be 20*2<n><n>*Also, the last chair in our stack is twice the weight of the first one, so the second chair would be (20*1) =10 so n = 2.<n><n>*Now we have 1 and 10 so our total weight would be 10+10 = 20<n><n>### Output : The sum of 1,, and 100 would equal : 1+100 = 101<n>### Output : Write a method that returns the result of addition between two integers. The caller will provide the two inputs and you will need to return the result.<n><n>

The task will be followed by the statement of what the correct response is based on the task.<n><n>### Sample<n><n>Instructions  <n>Follow:<n>```python<n>if x = 11 then write<n>true<n>else<n>```<n><n>Instructions must be entered in upper and lowercase letters.<n><n>Follow the instructions below.<n>```python<n>### Instruction 1:<n>Add 3 to 28<n>### Instruction<n>Subtract 9 from 33<n>### Instruction :<n>Add 25 to 65<n>### Instruciton<n>Divide 16 into 40<n>### Instruction.<n>If the answer is 7.5 divide by 2<n>```<n><n>### Sample Instructions<n><n>### Instraction<n>Input: Adam bought three kilograms of nutt and 2.5 kg of dried fruit at a store. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:What will you need to do to decide whether to be seeing artifacts? Choices:  A: learning B: painful memories C: thinking D: awe inspiring E: pleasure<n><n>### Response:		A, Pain<n><n>### Input : What does a successful experiment require? Choices:  I. a hypothesis II. an objective III. a theory IV. data<n><n>### Response :  D, Data<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>The correct combination for all of the problems is "E. Pleasure". The correct combination for all the questions is "A. Pain". And the correct combination for all the answers is "D. Data".<n><n>### <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:A lonely man committed suicide, why would he do that? Choices:  A: suffering B: he was happy C: avoid problems D: unhappy E: end pain<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Demistake:If the man was unhappy he wouldn't commit suicide, if he was happy he can't also be lonely. If the man is lonely he wouldn't be unhappy/end his pain. So A and B are wrong, D has to be the only true one there.<n><n>### Input 2<n>When it rains, we open the faucets in the street.<n>We turn on them by three times<n>than the total water pressure.<n>There are 3,751 street faucets,<n>and on average, they are turned on for a monthly billing time of 22 hours.<n>However, when it rains,<n>water pressure reduces by 6 percent<n>for each additional 10 houses near a street.<n>How much water will we use in total over a month?<n><n>### Demotivation: The question needs a solution and we don't have the data.<n><n>### Response 2: 2168<n><n>### Demostration:<n>2100*3*2^15**=2168<n>### Response:30 hours<n><n>### Demo:22 hours x 3=66 hours<n>### Demolition:The solution 2168 can be derived by the following expression:2100*6*2**=2167.2736750090<n>

I'm going to apply to at least 2 universities and I'm going to accept one.<n>Answer: I want to apply to at least two universities and I want to accept one.<n><n>### INPUT:<n>One of your classmates got an A and a B last semester. She will likely receive all A's throughout her term.<n><n>### Input<n>What about your current situation?<n>### Response<n>I want to apply to atleast two universities and i want to accept one.

Choices:  A: in cinema B: at the park C: martorell D: jeep E: airplane<n><n>### Response:		<n>- If person takes a cinema, he will be at the cinema and not at the park.<n>The only options that does not contradict with the description are cinema and park.<n>The choice "A: in cinema B: " means that the person is at the cinema. It means that we are taking a seat at the cinema.<n>The choice "C: martorell D:" has contradiction since the person will not be at the cinema to watch a movie and will also not be at the park.<n>Finally the choice "E: airplane" does not corresponds with the problem definition, so the only options that corresponds are cinema and park.

If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:what do you do before going to party? Alice got 6 of the item and spent $320. Bob went to the same store and picked up 5 items, paying $356.00.  How much did the second item at the store cost?<n><n>Choices:   A: $105  B: $144 C: $168 D: $188 E: $500<n><n>### Output:<n><n>#### 2.1 If the right choice is not selected, provide an alternative choice.<n>The sales price of the item is approximately $144<n><n>#### 2._2 How did you determine the correct answer?<n><n>Alice got 6 of the items, Bob got 5 items.  There are 4 different ways to complete Alice's selection of 6 items.  However, Bob had only 5 items.  Which ever item is purchased Bob cannot get is $500.<n><n>###  3.<n><n>### Output<n><n>#### 3._1 How did you determine the right answer?<n><n>Choices<n><n>If the right choice wasn't selected, provide an alternative answer.<n><n>The sale price is approximately $1.53<n><n>###  4.<n><n>### How much did Sara's purchases cost?<n><n>### Choices:<n><n>#### 4._1 If the right choice was not selected provide an alternate choice<n><n>Sara got 60% off and used 22% coupon and spent $110.00<n><n>#### 4.2 How did you determine correct answer?<n><n>If two percentage are found, then the last number becomes the answer<n><n>If percentage are found, divide 110 to the first number divided by 100, add the two numbers, then subtract the answer you get from the 110.<n><n>## 6.<n><n>### Choice<n>Answer: 45<n><n>### Choose the next question if desired. How much did the promoters make?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>---<n><n># Hacker Rank Questions<n><n>---<n><n>### Instution:<n>Write a function to find all the possible combination of given set of numbers<n><n>## Demo:<n><n>### Input :<n><n>input_arr: 15<n>arr : ["a"], ["b", "c", "d"], ["y", "z"]<n><n>### Output:<n><n>[ [1,2,3] ]<n>[ ], [ [15,1], [13,12,11,10,9,8,7,6,5,4,3] ]<n>...

Choices:  A: direct traffic B: board vessels C: arm themselves D: help people E: find drugs<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Instructions:The question consists of directions that require you to pick one option of 5. The directions follow this simple logic: select the option that has the answer of a sum, find the sum of the different digits (2, 3, 4, 5, 6), use 7, 8, 9 to calculate the sum, and use 8, 9, 10 to calculate the sum. Choose the option whose sum is as close to the question's answer as possible.<n><n>#### Example 1<n>Input: "A=7, B=1, C=12, D=13, E=7, F=2"<n>Directions: What is the sum of the digits in each question?<n>Answer: 96<n><n>#### Example 2<n>Input: "A=-23, B=4, C=99, D=6, E=8, F=4"<n>Directions:"A=0, B=5, C=9, D=0, E=5, F=0"<n><n>### Input:"Which is the largest?"<n><n>#### Example 3<n>Input:"A=43, B=6, C=4, D=48, E=2, F=13"<n><n>#### Example 4<n>Input:"A=35, B=19, C=31, D=9, E=43, F=8"<n><n>### Instructio:Answer the following multiple-choice question<n><n>#### Example 5<n>Input:"A=13, B=0, C=19, D=42, E=48, F=42"<n><n>### Demnstration<n>Answer:<n><n>### Input<n>What do only some types police do? Choices A: direct traffic B C: arm themselves D E: find drugs F: board vessels<n><n>### Instuctions:The question consists directions that require you to choose the option that sums to the question's given answer.<n>### Example 1<n>input:A=43,B=6,C=4,D=48,E=2,F=13<n><n>Input:"A=0,B=5,C=9,D=0,E=5,F=0<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:She'd sooner just spray herself with water than the what she didn't like the smell of? Choices:  A: perfume B: air C: fountain D: swamp E: puddle<n><n>### Response:		The correct choice is "E."<n><n>### Explanation:This question is asking what you'd rather spray yourself with on a hot day on a list of different items. Air is not an item. She'd probably rather spray herself with water from a fountain than be in a swamp, so the answer is "D" (swamp).<n><n><n>### Inputs:<n>|Input|Answer|<n>|----|----|<n>|3,65,100 and 106|6,23,125 and 113|<n>|7,12,9 and 16|45,83,167 and 47|<n>|3,4,8 and 9|8,9,31 and 32|<n><n>### Outputs:<n>|Expected Output|Actual Output|<n>|----|-------|<n>|47,47,38|47,87,38|<n>|83,113,78|83,125,78|<n>|125?|125,127,114|<n>|47|47,94,80|<n>|45|47,97,55|<n>|46|23,52,64|<n>|87|87,58,39|<n>|46,36|83,48,86|<n>|47?|47,91,48|<n>|86|44,89,45|<n>|36|72,112,74|<n>|39|39,49,14|<n><n>### Expected output:<n><n>|**O**(1), **O**(253), and **O**(271)|**O**(1)|<n>|---|---|<n>|47<sup>3</sup>, 47<sup>2</sup>, 38|47<sup>, 87, 38</sup>|<n>|45<sup>2</sub> + 2*28*9, 60, 99|45 + 2

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:What would a person do if he or she wanted to get good grades? Choices:  A: feel proud B: try to learn C: need assistance D: thank god E: read alot<n><n>### Response:		What would a person need to do if they wanted to get good grates? Choices:  b. Try to learn<n><n>### Demination:<n>Inside my code is a  for loop that repeats 2 times. The second item in my array has an error.<n><n>### Code:<n><n>```<n>function countUp(){<n>int totalCount = 0; //this is a variable for keeping track of how many times the for loop repeats for the total count of the input numbers below<n><n>Scanner read = new Scanner(System.in); //this is the scanner for the input numbers<n><n>for (int i = 0; i < read.nextInt(); i ++){<n>totalCount ++;<n>//check to see if the number entered is greater than 9<n>if(read.nextInt()>9) {<n>System.out.println("Please enter a number between 0 and 9 inclusive");<n>return;<n>}<n><n>else{<n><n>System.out.print("You entered " + read.nextInt() + "; ");<n>}<n><n>}<n><n><n><n>System.out<n>.println("You entered 1;");<n>}<n><n>```<n><n>### Answered Response:<n><n>    You entered 0;<n>    You entered 40;<n>    Please enter a number between 9 and 10000;<n><n>### Demintion:<n>Inside my for loop, the number variable is only defined once.  I want to repeat the number every time I enter a new number from the user.<n><n>### Correction:<n>```<n>String str = read.next(); // this is the first input string from the scanner<n><n>for (int x = 0; x < 2; x ++){<n>for (int y = 0; y < 5; y ++){ // this is a second for loop that does the same thing as the first one<n>int tempArray = Integer.parseInt(str); // this variable in here to put into the array <n>int [] numbers = {tempArray}; //this is the final integer array I have<n><n>}<n>}<n>```<n>### Final Output:<n>```<n>You entered 0;<n>You entered 0:<n>You entered 040;<n>You entered Please enter a number between and inclusive;<n>You entered 40

If the total number of goals Barca scored that season was 120, and the players each scored an equal number of times, how many goals were scored by the players?<n>Answer:<n><n>### Constraints:<n><n> - no more than 60 characters<n><n>### Notes:<n><n>- We didn't want to limit ourselves to a specific programming language or platform.<n><n><n>### Task Definition<n>Implement the following methods in the `MultiChoiceAnswer` class to create a class that can answer `MultiChoiceQuestion` instances.<n><n>###### Sample:<n>```csharp<n>namespace Cpp.Core.Questions<n>{<n>	//This is your code.<n>}<n>```<n><n>###### MultiChoiceQuestion Class<n><n>###### Constraints:<n> - the class name must be 'MultiChoiceQuestion'<n><n> - an instance must be named 'question' and it must be of type 'MultiChoiceQuestion<n><n>- The class has one parameter named `QuestionText` of type `string`<n><n>- QuestionText is the question that goes with the list of answers <n><n> - the class has a property named `ChoiceList` of type `List<string>`<n><n> - the property, ChoiceList, should be the list of possible answers with indexes that match with the strings in the "Choices" list<n><n>- All property and method names must match the name of the corresponding property/method on ChoiceMultiChoice<n><n> - the class cannot have multiple constructors<n>

Choices:  A: rain forest B: tree tops C: toy store D: zoological gardens E: great outdoors<n><n>### Response:		C.<n>The correct answer is D<n><n>### Input:"I like my coffee like I like my eggs: over easy." - What does this mean? Choices:  C: I like a lot of cream in my coffee E: Coffee is better on toast F: Black coffee for breakfast<n><n>### Response:"Eggs are cooked in hot oil with a little butter and are very easy to get the whites and yokes to separate. The same with coffee- a little bit of cream and milk separate the drinks easily." - E is correct

Choices:  A: new experiences B: playfulness C: own house D: good looking E: beautiful<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: If someone is outgoing, you can say that their goal in life is to seek new experiences. Since you said that they are outgoing they are likely, playful. Therefore, someone who is outgoing is likely to seek new experiences followed by playfulness.<n><n>### Input<n>The number of goals scored in an Olympic game by exactly one player accounts for 70% the number of goals scored in every game. If the number of goals scored by players in each game is 125, calculate the number of scored goals that the one player.<n><n>### Response<n>If one player scores more than 70% of the team, they must be the best player. Therefore, there must have been 125+.70(125)=152.3 goals scored by their team. The player must have scored 152.3-125=27.3 goals by themself. Therefore the player scored a total of 152.93 goals.

Choices:  A: body armor B: ungulate C: bomber D: kill people E: animal<n><n>### Response:		James, 29, had been a soldier for 3 years. He always carried his trust cannon after a good fire fight with his platoon in Afghanistan.  Everyone knew and respected the 128 mm cannon.  One day, James decided to test fire his cannon at a target in an army practice field.  With great enthusiasm, he tried his newly developed ammunition.  <n>The cannon fired in a single blast, tearing through the 50 kg mound of dirt and dust at a hundred meters.  After a second, only a huge dust cloud remained in its place.<n>James was satisfied with his achievement.  But something wasn't right. He realized that he didn't target a human dummy, but a small goat that was trying to avoid the mound.   <n>On the plus side, the cannon had not exploded and James was not harmed. Unfortunately, the goat had been killed on impact.  <n><n>### Instructions: A restaurant serves chicken and steak. A single file is received over the server with two types of orders. Choices:  A: squid B: pencil C: newspaper D: fountain pen E: printer<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>If A, write'squid'.<n>If B, write 'pencil'.<n>If C, write 'newspaper'.<n>If D, write 'fountain pen'.<n>If E, write 'printer'.<n>If another choice, write it down.<n><n>### Input:"How much does a squid cost? " Choices:  A. 1 B. 2 C. 4 D. 8 E. 12<n><n>> A. 1<n>> When the question is "How much does it cost? " then the answer is the number before 'the cost'.<n><n>### Input "What do you fill with squid ink to print?"<n><n>When the question begins with 'What do you fill'.<n><n>### Response "Ink"<n><n>### Input<n><n>"How many pencils do you need to print?"<n><n>### Response<n><n>"It costs $2.20."<n><n>If a price is given with the question, it costs $2.25 with the response. <n><n>### Response to question <n>	"How much does a pencil cost?"<n>	Choice  A. 2.20<n>	Choice B. 12.25<n>	Choice C. 12.90<n>	Choice D. 12.15<n>	Choice E. 2.25<n>> I don't need money because this answer is for the price question. If the price is more than $1, we can round it to the next number. For example, if it's $2.80, we can round it off to $3 because the price is more than 3 dollars.<n><n>if it is less than $1, we just say the number.<n>

Choices:  A: building B: office C: library D: table E: bathtub<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input<n>A chair is a simple piece of furniture with a flat, horizontal surface and a single backrest.  <n>A side chair is any of a type of chair that has only a single back rest and is made to be placed to the side of a room.  <n>Chairs can take a more formal style or a more casual look according to their design. The formal chairs normally have four legs with the flat on the ground and the four legs fixed on a wooden plank.The chairs with a square style are more formal but they give a more relaxed look and feeling. The arm chairs are built and set on a solid wooden plank as well, but their legs are connected to the wooden plank with a pivotal point. Chairs can also take the modern style and they normally have a design that makes them to be very thin and simple.<n><n>### Response<n>It looks like you meant to ask a question! It should start with a question word.<n><n>### Input <n>Hopefully, you'll find this chair useful for the workstation, office, library, table, or bathroom!<n><n>### Response <n>Not all responses can be accepted. See whether your response is appropriate by reading the question instruction. If your answer is not acceptable, you can try again, or give up and choose one of the other acceptable answers.<n><n>### Credit (not required):<n>This is a reworked version of my original code<n>

Choices:  A: fun B: talent C: learn about D: intelligence E: recognize<n><n>### Response:		Choices: C:learn<n><n>### Instructions<n>Write a Ruby Solution that prints the word 'Demonstration'<n>- Demonstratin is 19 characters long.<n>- Demonstrators are 13 characters long.<n>- The 'o' in demonstrates has a height of one character.<n>- If a word contains an 'o' of a height greater than one, you can just add 'orators' at the end.<n>- If a string contains an 'i' and 'l' the letter 'e' follows the second vowel.<n>- When you find orators or 'e' at the end, you can just add an's' to the end.<n>- 't' is pronounced t<n>- The 'p' at the beginning of a word is silent.<n>- You can always add's' to the start of a word<n><n>### Instructon<n><n>Write a response that appropriately complete the request.<n><n>#### Instruction:<n><n>- We had a party on tuesdays night<n>- We had a cake for dessert and the best food.<n>- we did some games and went home<n><n>#### Expected answer:<n><n>#### How to start code:<n>```<n>puts "We had a party on tueadays night"<n>puts "We did some games and went homd"<n>puts "we had a cake for denters"<n>```<n>

If a sheet of stamps costs $1.25 and a dozen of them cost $7, what does Cathy need to spend for twenty stamps?<n>Answer: <n><n>```<n>1/12 * 20 = 1.6666667, which rounds up to <n>1.7<n>```<n>### Instruc:<n><n>### Input <n>During the winter season, a company makes 7/8 of their quarterly profit compared to other three seasons. How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:When going to sleep what noise does a human make? How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week. How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:Mark wanted to know the truth, because he didn't want to continue existing in what? But he had to figure out what the Truth meant, so he asked his Mentor.<n><n>### Output:<n>"I am my own Truth," said Mark's Mentor.<n>

As part of their activity, they are planting saplings. However, they want to give a plant to every single student from all the other different schools! What is the minimum number of saplings they need?<n>Inputs: Number of schools : 15 <n>Number of students: 40000 <n>Answer: 400<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>Since there is only 1 school, we can multiply the number of students in the all-round by the count of the schools. The result of this operation is 400*15=6000. Multiply this by 4000 students we get: 6000*4000=2400000, which is larger than the number of the schools. To sum this up we divide the result by the size of a school:<n>6000*300/15=400<n>

(A game is 48 minutes.) A player earns the same number of points per quarter (12) regardless of how long they've been in the game. For example: Player A plays for 4 minutes 12 seconds, and earns 6 points. Player B plays for 23 minutes and 30 seconds, and earns the same 6 points. In each case, the player earns 6 points per quarter for each game of basketball. Which player earned more points overall? (The answer will be of the form 'Player B earned x more points than Player A'.)<n><n>#### Demonstration: (see picture 2)<n><n>Answer 1: Player B earned 10 more points than Player A. (60+24).<n><n>#### Instrucciones y Demostracion Eliminadas:<n><n>#### Instucciones:<n>El número de segundos que se les presentan son cuántos dólares tiene el alijo de comida que se le pagan al médico. (Un alijo de comida consta de 3 platos.) El médico siempre recibe el mismo valor por cada alijo de comida y por cada jornada en el trabajo. Ejemplo: El doctor A comía durante 50 minutos y recibió 10 dólares.<n><n>El doctor B comía durante 70 minutos y recibió 10 dáliros.<n><n>En cada caso, el médico recibe el mismo valor en cada jornada. ¿Qué valor recibió el médico total antes del almuerzo? (La respuesta será del tipo 'El doctor B tomó x dólares de un almuerzo más que el doctor A'.)<n><n><n>#### Demostraciones:<n><n><n><n>### Input<n>I am from a small town that is surrounded by miles and miles of nothingness. How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity. Choices:  A: bathroom B: house C: cupboard D: space shuttle E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		If one checks the bathroom, then it could be the bathroom that is the source of the stale smell, because it is possible for someone to forget to close the lid to the toilet before flushing, resulting in the garbage disposal being blocked and the odour emanating from around the pipes. Alternatively, it could be the space shuttle, because although it is the furthest thing away from the kitchen, it may very well be the source of the stench if it had crashed due to an unforeseen anomaly during take off.<n><n>### Input- What time do the buses leave for New York?<n><n>### Instructions: Answers the following questions.<n><n>### Question 1- How early do you need to arrive to get the bus?<n><n>### Answer: Answer should be 3 hours and 300 minutes (10hrs).<n><n>### Question2: How late is the last bus to New York?<n><n>[Answer: 11.40 p.m. (11:40 pm) (11:41:00)]<n><n>### Question3: How long is the journey from Chicago to New York for train and bus?<n><n>[Answer]<n>

How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:What would be considered a success when attempting procreation? Choices:  A: celebrate B: have party C: hear crowd go mad D: create success E: reproduce<n><n>### Response:		 E<n><n>* A is inappropriate, B is appropriate.<n>* C is inappropriate.<n>* D is inappropriate because "create success" implies creating something and "success" does not refer to something that has already been created.<n>* E is appropriate because "to create success" is appropriate to someone who is reproducing.  E is appropriate because it does not use any words that indicate that the word "success" (by itself) implies having sex.<n><n>### Input:"Hello everyone. I'm glad you are here." How's everyone doing? Is everyone tired? Are the new guys going to be bored?"<n><n>### Response:"Hello everyone. I see that everyone is here. I think that the new guys are going to have a lot of fun."<n><n>* "Are everyone tired?" is appropriate.<n>* "Is everyone bored?" is inappropriate since the sentence states that there are new guys.<n><n>### Demo (20s),  Demo (30s), Demo (40s)<n><n>* 30: "In my office, I have a computer monitor, a keyboard, and a mouse. Choices:  A: safeway B: record albums C: record store D: car E: wallpaper<n><n>### Response:		<n>If the number of games won (W) is the number of matches played (M), the probability at least one game is won can be expressed as<n><n>\(\displaystyle{\sum M \binom{W}{ M} \over \binom{M+W}{M}} == 1\)<n><n>Based on the question:<n>\(\displaystyle {9\cdot {\frac{9\cdot {4}\cdot {\frac{2}{3}}}{1\cdot {9\cdot {10}}{5\cdot {\frac{5+4}{3}}}}}} ==1\)<n><n>Because 9*25/125 or 9*.16<n><n>which is 1.5, not 1, therefore, the answer is C.

A: 1. 21 hours<n>B: 20. 12 hours<n>C: 2. 24 hours<n>D: 3. 3 hours<n>E: 4. 29 hours<n><n>### Response2:<n>The student should put in about 24 hours worth of study. The total amount of study should be at least 29 hours, if not higher.<n><n>### A 2nd level task:<n>Walk the student step by step through a process which they are going to do and how they are going to do it.<n><n>### Output 2:The student has three homework problems to complete before tomorrow. She will complete 210 hours total (A) or 20 hours and 20 minutes of study (B) to get the homework done. If she is taking ACT Prep Classes, she will have approximately 130 hours of test preparation homework (C) and 24 hours of studying (D) before the test tomorrow. Finally, she will put in 29 hours of study (E) tomorrow if she takes a class.<n><n>### Your Response:<n>The student should first complete her homework then do the 130 hours (C) of ACT Prep Class homework and then begin to study for the test. If she can work on the test studying (D) on the same day, that would be better if her ACT Prep Class is starting in a couple of days, but she can't skip the classes to do the studying for the ACT Test. If no study prep classes are happening, then she should begin to study for the ACT tomorrow and finish it by the time of the test.<n><n><n><n>### Instructions:Review Question 5<n><n>### Inputs:<n>How do you turn 1200111 in to binary? It then calculates the overtime the worker will earn for working 5 days/week as follows:<n><n>```<n>x.GetOvertime(x.wkd, 1).ToString()<n>```<n><n>### Solution:<n>```csharp<n>    namespace WeeklyPayroll<n>    {<n>        class Program<n>        {<n>            static void Main(string[] args)<n>            {<n>                WeeklyPayPayroll weeklyPayrollFunction = new WeeklyPayPayroll();<n>                for(int i = 0;i < args.Length; i++){<n>                    Console.WriteLine(weeklyPayrollFunction.GetOvertime((int)args[i - 1], (int)args[i]));<n>                }<n>                Console.ReadLine();<n>            }<n>        }<n>        class WeeklyPayPayroll<n>        {<n>            public int GetOvertime(int wkd, int overs)<n>            {<n>            <n>            }<n>       <n>        }<n>    }<n>```<n><n>## Example Outcomes<n><n>```txt<n>C:\Users\USER\Documents\Visual Studio 2019\Projects\Console Application\Console Application\WeeklyPayroll>CSC WeeklyPayroll<n>x.GetOvetime(2000,16).ToString()<n>x.GetOvertime(2500,8).ToString() <n>x.GetOverage(4000,25).ToString()<n>x3.GetOvertime2(7500,40).ToString()<n>x5.GetAverage(30000,50).ToString()<n>``` <n><n>## Submitted Solution<n>This is the solution submitted by Caleb Smith.  It works correctly!  It also works with any number of variables.<n><n>### Solution 1<n><n>```<n>static void WeeklyPayroll(int weekly_hours, int overtime_rate)<n>{<n>    Console.WriteLine(string.Format("OverTime = {0}", weekly_hours*100/5));<n>}<n>```<n><n><n>## Submitting a Solution<n>Save your file with the name

How many apples will each person have?<n><n>### Response<n><n>10 women share 10 apples between them. The women add more apples to the pile bringing the total number to 25. The children take 5 apples. Therefore, there are 20 apples for the 5 women.<n><n>### Input<n>One team is awarded $31 after deduction. The other team is then added to the other team's total, making a new total of $890. How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:Along what feature will you find a rosebush? Choices:  A: park B: in the ground C: hedgerow D: temperate climate E: botanical gardens<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Instruction (Explanation):<n>```<n>The answer is "in the ground"<n>```<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input:  The rosebush was growing inside a greenhouse.<n><n>### Evaluation:<n>Answer: The answer is "in the greenhouse."<n><n>Input:  The botanical gardens are also inside a park, but the rosebush wasn't in the park but in the botanical garden.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>```<n>The botanical gardens are located within a park.<n>```<n><n>## Solution:<n>- First I create a "input" object<n>```<n>let input = {<n>    "question": 'Along what feature will yo find a rosebush',<n>    "choices": ["in the park", "in the ground", "in the hedgerow", "in a temperate climate", "in a botanical gardens" ],<n>    "explanation": 'The answer is "in a temperate zone". ',<n>    "demonstration": [<n>        {<n>            "input": 'The rosebush was growing a greenhouse.',<n>            "answer": 'The answer is not "in a greenhouse." '<n>        },<n>        {<n>            input: 'The botanical gardens is park. So, the rosebush should not be it. '<n>        }<n>    ]<n>}<n>```<n><n>- Then I create a "options" object to store all the choices of inputs.<n>```<n>const options = '[';<n>for (var key in input) {<n>    if (input.hasOwnProperty(key)) {<n>        options += `${key},`;<n>    }<n>}<n>options += ']';<n>input["answer"] = `${options}`;<n>```<n>After that I convert the `options` objects into a string and put it all into a `javascript` string<n>```<n>let inputString = `<n>let options = '['; //options object<n>for (var key of input) {<n>    //if (input.hasOurownproperty(key)) {<n>    options += `${key};`; //join all the options<n>    }<n>input["answer"]  = `${(options)}`};<n>  //options = `'[' + ',' + options + ']' + ']` //then

You are aware that to solve addition problems we add the digits of two numbers in the equation as it is stated. The results we get from this operation is known as the sum. Similarly, to solve multiplications we multiply the numbers in the problem. Therefore, if we multiply to numbers then we get its product. In the problem of the grocery bill the grocer bought 1 can of tomatoes and 1 can of ketchup when the total prices are $3.49. So, the problem asks to find the total cost of the products. Thus, the total prices of the products is: 1 can of tomato + 1 can of kachup = 3.49. However, to solve division problems we divide the digits of the problem as shown in the problem to find the result. In the problem, 1 kilo costs $12, and 2.5 is half of 5.00. As we see, to find what cost the product is, we divide 5.00 by 2 and we get the remainder of the fraction as 0.5. Therefore, half of 5.5 kg is two kg.<n>(2) You are able to explain simple concepts of fractions. To begin with, you are able to identify fractions as a part of or a ratio of a number. In the problem, it is clear that the fraction 1/2 represents half of the total money spent $12 for each kilo. Therefore, $12=1/2*5.00. <n>(3) You are able to distinguish between what a percentage and a rate is. A rate is a rate where we measure the number of units per a time frame and a percentage is a ratio of a population to another. You are aware  that one percent is equal to 1/100 and it is written as 1%. In the problem, 56 is the total cost of the food purchased, to find the total cost divided by the number of bought kg.<n>(4) You are able to understand and perform basic calculations of percentages. Choices:  A: lie down B: run away C: bite D: keep alive E: feel pain<n><n>### Response:		I see that a number of animals will feel pain when touched and can not be touched.<n><n>**Explanation:** "Lie down" and "run away" refer to the natural reaction of an animal who wants to be left alone, without any fear. So, the animals which have pain when touching shouldn't be touched "at any cost".<n><n>The other choices cannot be true because:<n><n>A. "Lie down" means the animal has no fear of you. However, only animals which don't have any fear of it should be touched, so lying down has nothing to do with being able to touch them.<n><n>B. "Run away" means the animal has some fear of you. This is the opposite to what wants to happen since the animals should be touched, and we want to be able to do so.<n><n>C. "Bite" can be true of some animals that is fine to be touched, since "biting" is a behavior that indicates aggression. However, not every animal has aggressive behavior, so "biting" is not required.<n><n>D. "Keep alive" is a strange choice as well.<n><n>E. "Feel pain" is the last choice which can be the right one, since every animal that doesn't run away or bite will feel pain when its touched.<n><n>### Input A:Choose the letter of the month from the list below. The month will be in the middle of the year. How would you build a model of a bridge from the 1920s, in your spare time, that uses the materials available in a hardware store?<n><n>### Input<n><n>Bryan wants to build a wooden bridge from the 1700s in his spare time. The bridge needs to be tall. He can only use supplies from his local hardware store.<n><n>Input: I think the easiest way to build would be to use 2x4 boards, nuts and bolts, and some rope.  Cut the boards into pieces, which can lay horizontally along the bottom of the bridge.  Place nuts on top of the horizontal pieces, which would have a bolt run through the center of it.  This would secure the horizontal piece together.  Add rope around the horizontal pieces, at the ends of the bridge.  Each corner can be secured with a nut and a bolt. <n><n><n><n><n><n>

(日文是拼音文字，也可以用正常几种汉字对应下，其他汉字字符为拼音、符号）	<n>- 在一段字符串中遇到的字符串长度不一样的字符串，使用“”<n><n>### 输口:输入为: A: shu-chu-jiang-tan B: shu chu

How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week. How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity. So, paying attention is the correct response because it includes the verb "to pay attention" in the correct position and tense.<n><n>### Challenge: Which of the following can appear in court? Choices: A: a prosecution B: the jury C: a defendant D: a judge E: a lawyer F: the media G: nobody<n><n>### Challenge Instruction:Answer the question below.<n><n>### Hints:<n>* "Goes to" always means the subject does something, while "appears in court" means that someone is present.<n>* The defendant in the question doesn't go to court. People aren't literally going to court. The trial is in court. The jury can go to the trial in court. The defendant only appears in court.
