How much does she now make per day if she works eight hours per day Monday through Friday?<n><n>### Response:"If I did this many days and paid it many dollars per day, I could do many things in a week."<n><n>### Input:"If I do this many days and pay it many dollars per day when there is no pay raise, I could do many useful things in a week." <n><n>### Response:'I think this is a good way to make one or more dollars a day.'<n><n>### Input:'I really know that with only this many days, I can do many good things with them because they are so good!'<n><n>### Response:(In any order):"This can cost so many hours" "I think this is a very fun game and activity" <n><n>### Instructons:Answer the following multiple_choice question.<n><n><n>### Input<n>Lucky is a clown.<n>He loves to dance.<n>His clothes are the color yellow.<n><n>### Response<n>Lucky can wear yellow pants, a yellow shirt, and yellow shoes.<n><n>### Input 1<n>Dad is a gym member.<n>He has a red gym membership card.<n>His gym membership card is 12 inches long.<n>He has a blue gym towel.<n>He also has a red gym towel.  <n><n>### Response 1<n>Dad's card is more than 12 inches.<n><n>### Output2<n> Dad uses the blue towel when he works out.<n>He uses the red towel when his sweat is red.<n><n>###Instructions:Answer the question below.<n><n>###Input:<n>Jamie's car and the car her roommate have are both maroon.<n>What is Jamie's roommate's name?<n><n>###Expectation<n>A name was given to answer the question above.<n><n>###Output:<n>The name given is Jamie's name.<n><n>###Expected Output2:The name given

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:What is an area with no grass where I can get things to sell at a roadside stand? Choices:  A: surface of earth B: rest area C: supermarket D: state park E: garden<n><n>### Response:		<n>This is a question that asks for the input, "What is an area with..." It has been completed with the input in the question, "What is an..." This input is the prompt that will show what type of word needs to be chosen as an answer. The other options are not the answer.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:They checked the weather one more time during the flight, they were on their way to paradise and wanted it to what? Choices:  A: look beautiful B: be happy C: change quickly D: occur here E: surprise us<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Based on the question, A,B,C,D,E cannot be a correct answer.  The only answer that can be correct can be choice C as it is the weather they were checking for.<n><n>### Input; The store sells three types of tomato sauce, and each type costs 50p less than the next cheaper one. How much cheapest of the type of sauces would be the same as a full price jar of peanut butter? <n>```<n>A. 300p<n>B. 250p <n>C. 200p <n>D. 150p <n>```<n><n>### Response;B<n><n>### Explantion; The cheapest of the tomato sauce would be a full jar of peanut and the cheapest is 250p.<n><n>### Reference:<n>https://education.nationalgeographic.org/resource/multiple-choice-questions<n>

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:What type of home is most likely to have an attic filled with historical items? How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:How is someone who loves their TV likely to feel about their remote? Choices:  A: attached B: nostalgic C: companionable D: likely E: close<n><n>### Response:		If they are watching tv with their remote,then there is no other person.so we feel Close towards the remote.<n><n>### Input:(25 * 2) +19<n><n>###  Response: 1525+19<n><n>## Input: 173 <n><n>## Response: 181 (75,85) <n>Between 75 and 85<n><n>## Input:2*(12+3)<n><n>## Response:3 <n>Multiply the number by itself, and remove two, and we are left with 3<n><n>## Input:32+(20-(7*5))<n><n>## Response:79 -(45+20)<n><n>## Input:100-100%+100%<n><n>## Response:0(2)*2%+1 <n>Multiply by 2, subtract first, multiply by 2 again, then subtract. Keep doing this to the right side of the equation. Get 0%. However, since the left side of the equation is already 0%, subtract the left side from the right side to get 1%.<n><n>## Input:6% of 54<n><n>## Response:54*6/100<n><n>## Input:x+(x-1)*(200-34)<n><n>## Response:(x+(x-1))*200-314<n><n>## Input:((n!/k!)+(k!/n!))/((n-k)!)(k-n)<n><n>## Response：((n!)/(n-k)!)/((n-k)!)*(k-n)<n>

La instrucción de salida debe asignar a la variable "n" que es el resultado de la expresión "m=n+5"<n>En la respuesta, escriba un comando 'WHILE' que asigna una variable o valor 'n' a la posición del resultado que muestra la instrucción'm=n+5'. <n><n>    WR

Choices:  A: theater B: refrigerator C: bakery D: grocery store E: oven<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: Theater<n>B: Refrigerator<n>C: Bakery<n>D: Grocery Store<n>E: Over<n><n>If you go to a theater, it can be a fun adventure with lots of interesting shows.  You could also be interested in taking your family to a theater for a show.  A refrigerator would only make sense if you want to store food.  You could also put your leftover birthday cake into your refrigerator if you don't have space in your kitchen.  A bakery is also a good place to buy birthday cakes from.  You could go to a bakery to buy a birthday cake for a friend if your friend does not have enough time to bake a birthday cake.  After seeing your friend's birthday cake and eating some pieces, you could go to your friend's house to eat the rest of the birthday cake. Going out to eat a cake at a bakery is a good way to make a fun outing with friends.  The bakery may also give you ideas for making a birthday cake yourself.  Going to a grocery store is also a good reason. A store's kitchen could get some ready-made birthday cakes for you if you don't feel like bakery.  Baking a birthday cake is also a good reason to do this kind of work. You could ask relatives to help you bake a cake before you're sick.  If they say "no" to help you bake the cake, they might let you know what to bring them instead of a cake.<n><n>If your work is to buy groceries and you buy ingredients at the grocery store without baking birthday cakes, you're not really baking any birthday cakes.  You're just picking up ingredients for your birthday cakes.<n>

Choices:  A: copy B: intelligent C: improved performance D: empowering E: have more knowledge<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Instructions:This question consists of a single statement of argument about two different opinions. <n><n>### Statement of Argument 1:<n>Many businesses have chosen to eliminate the use of animal testing and other types of testing that cause extreme suffering to animals. <n><n>## Statement of Argument 2:<n>There is clear economic benefit in conducting animal testing prior to allowing a product to be placed in the market.<n><n>### Which one of the following statements below can be used as an example, or evidence to support the opposing argument. Choices: A: Animal testing is sometimes necessary for the public good. B: Products in some fields are often not thoroughly tested and this causes many problems. C: Animals often react in unexpected ways during testing. D: There are many products that the public cannot enjoy without animal testing. E: Product testing should be performed on only healthy animals who do not suffer during the testing process.<n><n>### Response - D<n><n>### Democratization:Democracy is the worst form of government, except all other forms that have been tried. - Winston Churchill. <n>Democratization is the extension of democratic rule. <n><n>## Democratization:It is believed that democratization will help countries to achieve the desired conditions: rule of law, personal freedom, and open society. <n><n>## Dictatorship:Dictatorship can be defined as a state where a single person rules the country. <n><n>## Export/ Imports:  As exports are goods and services that are bought by citizens of other countries, it is necessary for countries to import, or buy, from other countries. <n><n>## Federalism:There are mainly only two forms of governments, federal and unitary. <n><n>## Free Trade:A free trade system is a system where goods can be produced and imported without any restrictions, and without any tariffs. <n><n>## Globalism:Globalism is a term that refers to the connection between countries. Globalization refers to the fact that the world has become one large "global village". <n><n>## Globalization:The increase in globalization has been possible because of the developments in communication and transportation. <n><n>## Illegal Immigration:Illegal immigration refers to the movement of people from one country where they do not have the correct documents, into another country.

Answer: 9988<n><n>Input:What's the opposite of the opposite of the opposite?<n><n>### Answer:Answer a question with a question.<n><n>## Question<n>The sum of integers from 1 to 9 is 45. And the product of the same numbers is.......................... What is the answer?<n><n>## Solution<n>The sum of integers 1 through 9 is 4+5+6+7+8+9 = 45. The product of 1 to 9 numbers is (1)(2)(3).................(9). This leaves (2)(3)(4)(5), but because the numbers are all odd and the order does not matter, all the factors are even and sum to zero, so the product of the numbers is zero.<n><n>A car dealership has 1,000 cars which is half the number of

How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:When he touched the exposed wire he shouldn't have found it surprising that he got what? Choices:  A: see work B: shocked C: humor D: startled E: funny<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Option A:<n>It may be necessary to draw out the picture to illustrate your thinking. We know he touched and the wire and the exposed wire. We also know he was surprised. The key here is he shouldn't have been found surprised. He shouldn't have been surprised, because he shouldn't have touched the exposed wire in the first place. I hope this is clear.<n><n>### Options B,C,D,E:<n>#### Option B:<n>This is a wrong answer, because, he wasn't hurt or injured, he just touched something he was warned not to touch. So, he should have found it unexpected and got hurt.<n><n>#### Option C:<n>This is a correct answer - yes he was surprised as he was told he'd get hurt, so he was shocked because what is not the expected outcome.<n><n>#### Option D:<n>He shouldn't have got shocked because he should have known better than touching the exposed wire.<n><n>#### Option E:<n>I'd say it is a wrong answer, maybe funny, but not startled, because he got what he deserved.<n><n>### ANSWER:<n>#### Option A<n><n><img class="img-thumbnail" title="startled-pic" src="./assets/question2.png" alt="startled-pic"><n><n>### Input :The answer depends on a single condition whose value is unknown. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:He had a hard time finding the room on his schedule, it was on the second floor and he got lost in the very large what? Choices:  A: school B: office building C: house D: hotel E: centre<n><n>### Response:		<n>The second floor<n>

Choices:  A: finger B: good health C: own family D: friends E: people<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The answer is A.<n><n>This word question asks to find a person (one person) in an "if/then" statement.<n><n>### Input(Reality):<n>A person with brown skin has brown skin in common with them, so the question is asking for the most common answer.<n><n>### Valid Inputs:<n>A, D, E, B<n><n>### Counterexample:<n>Brown skin = Person 1<n><n>### Example:<n>You are a brown person. You can share your brown skin with whom? A: Finger B: Good health C: Own family D: Friends E: People<n>

Choices:  A: solidifying B: melting C: getting cold D: feeling cold E: skin rash<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### What happened?<n><n>The weather is going to be dry.<n><n>### Input A: How many people need to help lift the tree so that it is lifted to the roof?<n><n>### Input B: Who should lift it 1 minute before and 1 minute after each group?<n><n>### Respose A<n><n>There are six people.<n><n>### Respone B<n><n>People should stand on stilts for the one minutes before and the minutes after each group so that they are standing on either side of the tree.<n><n>### Comment on the input<n><n>The second input doesn't have a choice D: feeling cold. Feeling cold is just what the narrator asks the reader in the beginning. After that the narrator mentions feeling cold in the beginning of the input.<n><n>### Choice B for Input A:<n><n>If the six people lift the tree at the same time it would be easier than lifting it one minute before and after each group.<n><n>### Easy way A:<n><n>The six people lift the tree all together at the same time. (Making a group of six people)<n><n>So six people lift a tree. It would be hard for six people to lift a tree at once without putting it down.<n><n>They all have to lift each other up so that they can lift the tree.<n><n>If they were to be standing on stilts, they would still have to lift each other and the tree with the stilts since it would be hard for a person to lift a tree.<n><n>Once they get each other up high enough, they should each lift the trunk up at the same time.<n><n>If you lift the trunk and put it on the stilts with you, you might not be able to fully lift the tree.<n>

How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:Where could you find a bookstore? Choices:  A: desire B: spending money C: money D: needs E: time<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>You need money to be able to buy things. A job, a salary and selling things you have in your home. But most importantly you need money!<n><n>### Instructions: What is 3/5 of x increased by 2?<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>If you are going to have x which is equal to 10. Then x increased by 2 is equal to 12. Three of those are equal to one fifth of x which is equal to three fifths of 10 which is equal to x*. You should multiply x* by 10 which is 1.5 so the equation is 3/5 times x*. The answer is 15.<n><n>### Input 1: How do you get to a thousand? Choices A: 1 B: 2 C: 3 D: 4 E: 5<n><n>### Instructino: How many times do you have to multiply 10 by itself to equal "1000"?<n><n>### Answer<n>We multiply the number 10 by itself for each step to reach 1000. Firstly we multiply it by ten to make 100. Then we multiply it by 10 to make an extra hundred to make it 200. Next up we keep repeating this. The last 2 digits in the number are 00 which are simply the end of the number we are multiplying ten by itself. If you write the number down you will be able to see that 0 0 is the result of multiplying ten by itself so many times that the result is equal to 1 0 0 0. When you multiply something by itself that many times that is called squaring something.<n><n>###Input 2: How do you write 30 as a fraction less than half?<n><n>###Instruction: <n>Write the fraction as a fraction less than one half that is equal to 30.<n><n>###Answer:<n><n>First write the fraction as a fraction and then find the answer, in this case x. Choices:  A: pain B: mudslide C: sweating D: injuries E: rain<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input:[A] The following table shows the number of days each player participated in an activity in the past 6 months.<n><n>![Days of an activity each player participated](https://github.com/H-JE/Python_Problems/blob/master/Python%20problems/Chapter6/data_mining/Week_6/question7/day_of_participation.png)<n><n>From the histogram, we can see that the majority of players on the tennis team, which has 4 players, have participated in the activity in the first half of the week. The probability of participation in a particular day of the week is proportional to the height of the histogram.<n><n>The total number of days of participation for the tennis team is `N_Tennis = 55`.<n><n>### Response :<n>The total number of matches of the matchmakers is `N_Matchmakers = 3`.<n><n>The total number days of participation for the matchmakers is then calculated as follows:<n><n>![Image from DATA MINING 4361](https://github.agmooc/python-data-science/blob/master/Week%206/question%203/3.PNG)<n><n>So the total number of days of activity is `N_Total = 850`.<n>### Input:The probability of rain increases every hour in the day. The probability of rain on any given hour, given that it rained 2 hours before is `P(rain_in_hour|rain_2_hours_before_hour) = 1 - P(don’t rain in hour given that it has rained 2 hours in the past)`, where 0.15 is the probability of it raining in the two hours before.<n><n>What is the probability of it not raining at 3 PM given that it did not rain between midnight and 3 PM?<n><n>### Solution:<n><n><n>#### Input :<n><n>![Input](https://github.githubassets.com/images/modules/open_files/26298394/rain_conditions.png)<n><n>#### Question:<n><n>While the question says to find the probability of rain not happening after 3 PM, it should actually find the probability of rain happening after

The choices are wrong because of some spell errors.<n><n>### Input : What is -723452 / 4? Choices: 1: 18071 2: 1 3: -7234 4: 3<n><n>### Response : 1 is correct.<n><n>### Output: What is 9 * 7? Choices: 5:27 6:14 7:15<n><n>### Response 1: 5:2 is the correct answer.<n><n>### Difficulty level 2:<n><n>### Input<n>Input: They launch a surprise attack, then the cease fire was declared after 3 days.<n><n>### Processing:<n>The correct answer is 'defend'.<n><n>### Output<n>Output: What is -728 * 2? Choices: <n>6:31<n>1 A:3<n>B:9 <n>C:289<n>D:9<n><n>### Response<n>1 is the correct answer. The rest of the choices are incorrect and can be proved wrong just by dividing -728 by 2.<n><n># Difficulty Level 3:<n><n>### Challenge:<n><n># Input:I want to know how much will be left when I subtract $100 to $74.99.<n><n>### Answer 1:<n>74.01, 74.00, 74, 73, 72, 0, -70<n><n>### Answer:<n>0.01, 0, 0, -10<n><n>### Process:<n>The correct answer has 0 decimal places. So I have to check the other answers. The 74.01 should yield 0 when subtracted with 100, so the answer is 74.0(1 digit) instead of 74.0.00(2 digits). The choices with 74.0 and 74 are not correct because they have 2 digits. So the answer must remain 0.01 or 0. The choices with -10 yield 0 when subtrated with 100 instead of -74.99 which is the answer to the

You were " + target);<n>                break;<n>            } else if (guess > target) {<n>                document.querySelectorAll(".container").innerHTML += "<p class='mensaje incorrecto'>" + "that is greater than " + target;<n>            } else {<n>                document.getElementsByClassName("message-error").innerHTML += "<p">You are less than " + target + " Try again!</p>";<n>        }  }while (target > guess);<n>    }<n><n>### Instructio:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Demo:<n><n>Input: Adam bought three kilograms of nutz and twenty-five centimeters of dried-fruits at a store. Choices:  A: unfeeling B: negligence C: antipathy D: indifferent E: rapport<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>> **D. Indifferent**<n><n>### Instructions:  Write the number of the best answer.<n><n>### Input 1: If a man walks 20 paces per minute and the woman walks 25 paces per minute, in how many hours does it take for them to reach a point 210 miles away?<n><n>### A. 48<n><n>### B. 30<n><n>### C. 53<n><n>### D. 45<n><n>### E. This number cannot be determined without additional information.<n><n>### Correct answer:<n><n>> **B. 30**<n><n>### Reason:<n><n>The two walk at the same speed, so 1 mile per hour (1 mile/hr) is equal to 21/210 miles per hour (or 1 mile/3.14 hours). To find how many minutes it takes, divide the rate by 31.14 to get minutes per mile, and multiply by miles per hour. Then multiply by 30 to get minutes. Using the multiplication is easier than division, so it takes them 120 minutes. To find the resulting hour, divide by 60, the number of minutes in an hour.<n><n>To do this calculation without the numbers given, we would first convert from miles per hour to miles per day and then divide. If 1 mile is equal to 10,000 meters, and 63 divided by 60 is 63/60 == 1 mile per day, then 210 divided by 60 = 3.5 miles per day. That makes: 3.5 days in a week == 1 hour + 1 hour + 2 hours per day. It takes 12 minutes per hour divided by the mile, or 3.33 minutes to walk a mile. This gets multiplied by 210 to come out to 710 hours to walk to the point. We can divide that by 24 to convert hours to days, or 30 days to get the result. The correct answer is B: 30.<n><n>### Notes:<n><n>If I had to express this in words, I would say that you could do multiplication or division, but because the hours are already in there and not

Choices:  A: skate B: play piano C: fiddle D: play piano E: have fun<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: play piano<n><n><n><n>#### Solution<n><n>```cpp{<n>// 100 - 1 = 99 <n>let counter = 100; <n>let index;<n>let arr = ['a', 'd', 'c', 'b', 'e']; <n><n>for (let i = 0; i < 6   ; i++ ){ <n> let val = arr[i]; <n> console.log(`${i} - ${val}`); <n> if( val === answer ){ <n>  index = i; <n>  console.log(`I have finally found the index of ${answer} which is ${index}!! `);<n>} <n> <n>if (arr.includes(answer)){ <n> console.log('Found');<n>}<n>else{ <n> console.log ('Not found'); <n> break; <n>}<n> console.log('total', counter); <n> counter--; <n>} <n>}<n>```<n>The below code is just to see whether the given answer exists in the given options.<n>It is really tedious to figure out the index. So, I have used a function that takes two parameters. The first is the array and the second is what we are looking for.<n><n>If the answer exists in the array, then the function returns the index where the answer lies. If the answer doesn't exist, then it returns -1.<n><n>```cpp{  <n>function findIndex (arr, answer){ <n>   if (arr.includes(str)){ <n>    return arr.indexOf(answer); <n>   }<n>   else { <n>    return -1; <n>   } <n>}<n><n>let result = findIndex(['a', 'd', "c", 'b', 'e'], 'd');<n>let index=result  <n>let answer= 'd <n>console.log('index : ', index); <n>console.log("We found D!!!  ` <n>}`<n><n>```<n>It will not work if you put the quotes inside the findIndex. The reason why is that we've been accustomed to writing variables of string types enclosed by strings.<n><n>

Choices:  A: grill B: go to market C: bring home fish D: eat hamburger E: make bread<n><n>### Response:		<n>> E --> bring home fish<n><n>### Explanations:<n>**A: grill**<n>The definition is not true.<n><n>**B: go to market**<n>The question is asking what a way to relieve hunger. Therefore, it should be the answer of choice B. Additionally, there is an idiomatic phrase "go to market" that means to go shopping. In shopping, the buyer usually grills in a local market.<n><n>**C: bring home fish**<n>The question is an open question. As an open question is more difficult than a closed question, the question should be answered by the easiest option.<n><n>**D: eat hamburger**<n>The question contains the word "fisch", which is a German word for fish. Also, the question is asking about the way to relieve hungers. Therefore, it should not be the answer.<n><n>**E: make bread**<n>The definition of the answer is that the activity means to relieve your hungers. However, the question has a different meaning. "bring home fish" means that get you home fish.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: What is a place to get a hot meal and a place to stay the night? Choices: <n>A: Hotel B: restaurant C: motel D: cafeteria E: guesthouse<n><n>### Response<n>> C --> motel<n><n>### Explanaiton<n><n>**A: Hotel**<n>The choices that we have been provided are already hotels. The choices are also in the range of choices in the actual answers. "Hotel" is a place to stay. However, it does not have dining places.<n><n>**B&D&E: Restaurant&Motel&Guesthouse**<n>The choices that have been provided are in a range of choices of answer. "Restaurant&Motels&Guesthouse" are all place to stay. However they are not a place to get a warm meal.<n><n>**b: motel**<n><n>The question is asking about dining place.  In addition motel have the activity of dining. <n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>In this instruction, you should provide an answer that appropriately completes each statement or question.<n><n><n>### Instraction:<n><n>Answer the following question<n><n>I can

How many points will you earn each day if you work 1 hour each day of the week?<n>Answer:<n>20 hours / 1 hours = 20 <n><n>### Hints:<n>There are 300 points to be  earned in the week. For how many hours did each member worked on the boat?<n>Answer:<n>Tom - 6 hours<n>Stella - 8 hours<n>Twinkle - 7 hours<n>Emilio - 5 hours<n><n>### Hight:<n>How many hours did it take to fill the truck?<n><n>Answer: 6 hours<n><n>### Demostration:<n>If you walked 1 miles in 5 days and walked 6 miles in 6 days you would have walked 11 miles.<n><n>### Demo:<n>Answer the following simple math question.<n><n>## Demostration:How much did John earn in that week<n><n>Answer:<n> 1015 <n><n>### Instuctions:<n>A boy has four pairs of socks. How many socks does he have if he has one red sock, one green sock, one brown sock, and two purple sock?<n><n>Answer:<n> Four pairs of socks does he have<n><n>## Demostratio:What did Tom put in his beverage<n><n>Answer:<n>21323<n><n>## Demoslratio<n>There are 24 houses in a suburb. It took one bricklayer 12 hours per day to lay every brick to build the houses.  How many hours did it take bricklayer to build the 24 houses?<n><n>Answer:240 hours<n><n>## Demostrating:<n>How many grams are in a kilograms?<n><n>Answer:1000 grams<n><n>### Instractions:<n>There are 40 students enrolled in a dance class where the instructor teaches in three one-hour sessions of dance. How much time have the 40 students to learn how to dance?<n><n>Answer:400 hours<n><n>### Instatractions<n>What is in 7 plus 9?<n>

Answer each question by choosing the best possible equivalent replacement item.<n><n>### Input1:Sven buys 30 eggs and 10 bottles of ketchup and 10 cans of beer and 20 baguettes.<n><n>### Response1:<n><n>* 2 boxes of eggs<n>* 1 bottle of ketchup<n>* 1 can of beer<n>* 20 baguette<n><n>### Input2:Martha's birthday is in 2 weeks. The party lasts 2 hours. There are 15 kids for a total of 30 guests at the party. There are 21 cakes.<n><n>### Reply2:<n><n>* 15 candles and 15 candles<n>* 21 children<n>* 5 bags of trash<n><n>### Instuctions:Each of the above calculations produces a specific number within the range given. In each case, identify the missing number. The first and last of the missing numbers are also given.<n><n>### Output1:Calculations:<n><n>* 62 + 16 * (x) = 108<n>* 150 – 4 = (x)<n>* (x * -2) * 2 = 12<n>* 15 + 3 + (x) = 37<n><n>### Response<n><n>The above calculations produce the number 15 as the missing number.<n>### Output2:<n><n> * 50 + ((x - 1) / 2) = 96.25<n>* 2 + (4 x (x-1)) = 208.92<n><n>### Response2:<n><n>* The above calculations produce 6 as the missing number.

How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:The crab was scuttling but strained when he moved, what was impeding him? Choices:  A: tide pool B: beach sand C: tidepools D: current E: cooking pot<n><n>### Response:		<n>*Answer A is scuttling. Crabs scuttle along the surface of the ocean floor.<n><n>*Answer B is shoreline. Crabs scurry along the edges of rocky shorelines, looking for a snail to eat.<n><n>*Answer C is current. When the tide turns and pushes the crab from its home to new ground, crabs scuttle.<n><n>*Answer D is tide pools. When the tide is high, sea crabs swim. Once the waters start to recede, crabs scurry back behind rocks and tide pools.<n><n>*Answer E is cooking pot. There are many recipes and cookbooks for crabs. Seafood aficionados prefer them steamed or baked because they contain more fat than crabs that have been dredged for other seafood dishes like jambalaya or pasta.<n><n>### Input - The newborn puppy ran back to its mother’s side and hid under a bush. Choices: A newborn dog B a tiny wolf C a very young bear D a very small fox E a little baby tiger<n><n>### Response -<n><n>*Answer A is newborn dog. Newborn puppies are born with two openings. A bitch usually gives birth to 2 to 10 puppies, but may have as many as 16 or more, especially if there are more than two puppies in the litter. Newborn puppys have large heads and are tiny in size. They are blind and deaf for their first couple of days in life, and are totally helpless without their mother for warmth, and protection from the cold and dangers outside.<n><n>*Answer b is a very young wolf. The young usually stay with the nesting female until she no longer requires milk from them. In most species, only the females care for the young; thus wolf packs are made up solely of females. In a wolf pack that stays together throughout the year, some wolf puppies stay with the pack, while others return to their original pack.<n><n>*Answer c is a very young baby bear. Newborn baby bears, commonly called cubs, are tiny and blind, born either partially in an upended sleeping tree or in a hole

Choices:  A: food B: cargo ship C: refrigerator D: closet garage E: port<n><n>### Response:		Answer:B<n><n>A) food B) cargo ship C) refrigerator D) closet garage E) port<n><n>B) cargo ship<n><n>### Demostration: <n><n>The container is a cargo ship.<n><n>### Input :Write a program that answers the questions below.<n>What is the sum of the first 100 natural numbers?<n><n>### Response : <n><n>The sum of the first 20 natural numbers is: **1001**<n><n>**The sum of the first N natural numbers is: 10 x 10^(N-1)**<n><n>The sum of all the natural numbers is 1*10^0 + 2*10^1 + 3*10^2 + 4*10^3 + 5*10^4 +... + 10^0<n><n>Therefore, with N natural numbers, the sum is: (N-1)*10^0<n>

After 6 turns, the sequence is revealed to the audience and the host declares the winner. The team is divided into 7 groups, with the first group starting from the north heading south through the center of the forest and the last group also starting from the south and heading north until the first group of bikers meet again. Every 3 hours, a bike breaks down. How long will it take for each group to pass each other?<n><n>##### Input<n>A: Team 1 has 10 bikers.<n>A: Team 2 has 9 bikers.<n>...<n>E: Team 7 has 5 bikers.<n><n>##### Response and Explain<n>The groups will meet every 3 hours because they meet at the border, starting north, and travel into the forest. Each time that a group of bikers meets others, they pass the 3 bikers that were between them. They pass the north group 3 times in the first 10 hour time period because they meet them only once, and they pass the south group 3 times in one of those 10 hours time periods. Each team passes the same number of bikers per hour; they

A: self-pity  B: communication  C: understood  D: pain  E: embarrassment Answer: D <n><n>### Response<n>### Demonstra:<n>A: self-pity<n>1.  You would be feeling pain, which is self-pity.<n>2.  The bruise is the reason of the pain.<n>B: communication<n>1. You don't have no choice but to tell what happens and who's to  blame.<n>2.  You can tell someone your story.<n>3.  You will just communicate what happened to you.<n>C: understood<n>1. If someone is empathetic and he understood your predicament, you can say you are understood.<n>2. When you are angry, you say that you are understood.<n>3. And in an unfortunate situation, you want to be understood and not mock.<n>D: pain<n>1. You are having pain at that time and  it might be  self-pity  pain.<n>2.  For you to be at a pain, you will need to be having a bruise that time.<n>3.  So in every possible situation, you are painful.<n>E: embarrassment<n>1. If you are bruised and you want to show that  you are  embarrassed, you will tell that.<n>2. You can tell that you are embarrassed of what happened to you at the  time.<n><n>### Feedback:<n>You are correct! Your answer is: D

Choices:  A: city B: michigan C: three feet D: subdivision E: three arm span<n><n>### Response:		<n>D<n><n>### Demostration:<n>- [Yard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yard)<n>- [City](https://en.britannica.com/place/city)<n><n>### Input 1:<n>Eight chickens can graze on a yard in three minutes. How many yards (at most, since some are being used) can 25 chickens graze in three hours?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>### Demos:<n>- [Chicken](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Chicken_breed&oldid=879301044)<n>- [Minute](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/minute)<n>- [Grazing](https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/gazing)<n>- [Three](https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/three)<n><n>### Problem:<n>We have a yard with a chicken coop. There are a total of 20 chickens, half of which are in the coop. In order to count as grazing in the yard, the chickens need to be outside of the coop. In three hours, the coop can only contain the following amount of chickens:<n><n>$$max\{2*A-B,0\} = max\{(200-5)*25,0\} $$<n><n>$$max\{100-5,0\} = max\{100,0\} $$<n>which simplifies to: $$40$$<n><n>Therefore, there are 40 chickens that are outside of the coop,  and each of them will graze 8.5 yards as described above. If there are 25 chickhens in the coop, that means there are a total of 65 chickens, but there are only 40 outside of the coop with 8.5 yards to graze with. Therefore, 65-40 = 25 chickenson, which can stay in the coop.<n><n><n>### Input2:<n>Pretend you have 300 pennies. After you buy some snacks and a soda,
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. Choices:  A: exhausted B: lonely C: worked all day D: were very tired E: feel better<n><n>### Response:		A: exhausted<n>### Answer:B<n>### Instruction<n>* Write the response that completes this instruction. The response is in bold.<n><n>### Question:What is my favorite color?<n><n>### Response<n>* The correct response is A, “blue”, B, “green”, C and E “red”, D, “yellow”. The incorrect responses are orange, “gray”, “brown”.<n>* There are _____ choices, but only one is correct.<n><n>### Answer<n>* C and E are incorrect because they are outside of the set of choices the question gives. E: feel better is not a choice for how are you feeling since there are no feelings left to be feeling. C: worked all day is also incorrect because the response should be what one actually did in the past, not a suggestion for what one might think was done in the past.<n>* Option A, “blue”, is the correct response.<n>* Option B, “green”, is the other correct response.<n>* Options C and E are incorrect as they are not the choices given from the prompt.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The instruction contains 5 different choices, but the correct one is only on options A and B. Option C or E could be correct if they are answered correctly, but since their options aren’t correct neither are the rest of the possible outcomes.<n>

So each friend walks one roundtrip concession and gets two hot dogs.

Mental Health: An interjection to what is considered, “civil” (i.e. normal) behavior.<n>2. Addiction: An addict is someone who is dependent on a thing or a thing/person that gives them “special feeling, and if not received, can produce a negative reaction or result.” An addict is addicted to the good or the high that they receive.<n>3. Trauma: What causes a person to lash out is not always known. Some people suffer from some type of trauma that causes them to be aggressive, lash out etc. Trauma can include sexual harassment, bullying.<n>4. Economic Factors: Economic status can cause a person to act in an inappropriate form of aggression. Economic status can range from homelessness, low income, etc. <n><n>### Response<n>- A <n>- C<n>- B <n>- E <n>- D<n><n><n>---<n>### Description<n>Repeat after me.<n>```<n><n>How to complete a task.<n>The first word is the task/instruction.<n>The word after it is how to complete the task.<n>```<n><n>### Answer<n>Repeat after me again.<n>```<n><n>This will be used in the next sections to describe how to complete a task.  The instruction word goes first and the response word goes second.<n>```<n><n>---<n>## What the answer is telling us<n><n>### Description<n>In this section, there is a story. How to explain your solution<n>3. How to format your code<n><n>To be able to successfully implement, code/program, solve/do the task.<n><n>---<n><n>## Writing Task<n>### Instruction 1 <n>How to do a writing task<n><n>### First Answer<n>How to write the first answer<n><n>### Second

Each list, A through E, includes a statement from a government agency, a statement from a conservative group, a social-liberal group, and a libertarian group.  For some statements all four groups agree; for others, their responses vary greatly.  For each statement, read the description and find the government response if it appears somewhere in the list. <n>- Government:<n><n>Both the National Institutes of Health and the World Health Organization agree that using a drug called Ruxolitinib to treat the most dangerous form of psoriasis is unhelpful<n><n>- Social-Liberal Group:<n><n>The Center for Disease Control believes that allowing the government to regulate the use of Ruxolitinib is harmful in some places<n><n>- Conservative Group:<n><n>Liberal groups agree that it is best to allow Americans to choose to use Ruxolitinib as it has helped them<n><n>- Libertarian Group:<n><n>Libertarians believe that Ruxolitinib works for many and should be allowed by all<n><n>### Incorrect Choice:D<n><n>### Correct Choice:F<n><n>### Input and Response<n>![](https://learn-data-analytics-python.algolia.org/api-fil...

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week. How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. Choices:  A: math book B: phonebook C: statistic D: music school E: office<n><n>### Response:		<n>The operations included in Math, can be studied in a Math book. Also, there are some operations available in a phone book. However, it is unlikely that a person knows anything about the number of operations available in a phonebook. Finally, most music or statistical books do not have mathematical operations in them. This, therefore, shows that a person should learn about operations in a Math book<n><n>### Input : How many times will 60 divide exactly into the number 72,000?<n><n>### Response :<n>If divided into the number 70,000.  It will be 0.086 (0.086 = 0.08 × 10,000). Therefore, the answer is 86 (eighty six).<n><n>### Input How many multiples of 20 are there in 100?<n><n><n>### Response.<n>There are 80 multiples of 2 in 100 which is not a multiple of 2 or a multiple of 20. This is shown because 10, 20, 30, 40, 50 and 60, are all multiples of 2 and not multiples of 2 or 20. As there are 80 in 100, there must be exactly 8 multiples of 2. 20, 40 and 60 are there. Therefore, 10 multiples of 5 are there. They are 20, 25, 30, and 35. Finally, there is a number with a zero in its tens places; which is not a multiple. As there are 100 multiples, there are 80 multiplers.<n><n>### Input.<n>24<n><n>### Response<n>8446<n><n>### Input<n>Answer: 5 hours<n><n>### Response <n>Brians 20 trials for 2 days.  Every day he got one fewer trial than before. This gives him a <n>total of 18 trials in 2 days. He got 36 hours of free time, and he got 36 hours minus 18 trials, <n>giving him 18 trials. Therefore, the minimum number of trials he had in total

Choices:  A: outer space B: night sky C: universe D: orbit E: the ground<n><n>### Response:		The answer is d. <n><n>### Instructions:<n>This question requires you to use the rules of English grammar to construct a sentence from several fragments of grammatical instructions.<n><n>### Difficulty: 7<n><n>### Instrumental tasks:<n>1. Avoid passive voice (verb + BE + past participle) when using a verb.<n><n>2. Avoid using the prepositions "in" and "onto" when the phrase refers to a physical location.<n><n>3. Avoid using double negative constructions when they can be replaced with a positive construction or a phrase to avoid repetition.<n><n>4. Avoid using "that" to introduce a non-essential clause.<n><n>5. Avoid phrases including the conjunction "and + [that...]" when not required.<n><n>6. Avoid ambiguous uses of the pronoun "I" by referring to self rather than to a pronoun.<n><n>7. Avoid using the adverb "instead" as a past participle.<n><n>8. Avoid wordy expression such as "in the year [the year in which...]" to refer to a particular year.<n><n>9. Avoid repeating the month name twice (such as "November November"), as the month is implied from the year or day.<n><n>10. Avoid using "this" or "that" to refer to what is already obvious from surrounding context in English.<n>11. Avoid repeating a word twice within a single sentence.<n><n>12. Avoid using adverbs to specify quantity where possible.<n><n>13. Avoid unnecessary hyphens.<n><n>14. Avoid starting a sentence with "A... is..." construction.<n><n>15. Avoid prepositional phrases starting with "for" that refer to the future.<n><n>16. Avoid subject-predicate inversions.<n><n>17. Avoid using a pronoun as an object.<n><n>18. Avoid subject-verb inversions with the exception of "it is I".<n><n>19. Avoid using the contractions "I'd" and "it's".<n><n>20. Avoid forming questions with the word "that".<n><n>21. Avoid using the word "any" to refer to people.<n><n>22. Avoid unnecessary

Choices:  A: teach B: cost money C: do work D: be productive E: help people<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input/Response: 71<n><n>### Instructions: Please answer the questions below.<n><n>Question 1: What is the cost of 3 kilograms worth of nuts and 5 kilograms of fruits at the store (in dollars)? Choices: 12 for 1 12 for 2 32 for 3 42 for 4 84 for 5 168 for 6<n><n>Question 1 Answer: The correct answer is 84 for 6. One kilogram of dried fruits costs $8. And one kilogram of nuts worth $12. Thus 3 kilograms will be $36.  Likewise 5 kilograms worth of dried fruits cost$40.  So 3 kilograms+ 5 kilograms=$86. This is equivalent of 868 milliliters.<n><n>84 for 6<n><n>If 868 is 6<n><n>1235<n><n>6<n><n>### Question 2: What does the number of hours spent at the gym in a week represent when 2/3 of them are for weight lifting and 1/3 for warming up and cardio? Choices: 2/3 the number 1/2 the number 1 3 2<n><n>Question 2 Answer: 1/2 the hour. The one third and two thirds doesn't represent what. It just represents the time divided by weightlifting and cardio.<n><n>1/2 the hour<n><n>If 2/3 are for weight lifting<n><n>1/3 are for cardio<n><n>1/2 hour<n><n>### Question3: What are the values of the prices of fuel before and after the 20% increase? Choices: 480 576 504 5760<n><n>Question 3 Answer: How do you know this is 480<n>120*3/2 = 4 72*3+32 = 4 80*2+30 = 4 86*2+34 = 4<n><n>584+4 = 480 it is all because of 20 which you see in three places. 20

Choices:  A: ouch B: skip C: enjoyed D: awesome E: watch television<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The children saw superman flying overhead.  They exclaimed with enjoyment.<n><n>### Justify:<n>The verb "exclaim" means "express great surprise or emotion".  This suggests joy.<n><n>### Note:<n>There are five questions, so there are five responses.  The fifth question is similar to the first so it doesn't need a new one.  You must identify the correct response from the possible responses.  You may not choose something other than what is shown.  The answer to the fifth question is not A.<n><n>### Inputs:John is on a hunt for mushrooms.  He found 10 mushrooms of 3 different kinds. Choices:  A green mushroom, a red mushroom, a yellow mushroom, and a brown mushroom.<n><n>### Response(s):<n><n>John is on a hush for mushrooms, but he only found green and red mushrooms.<n><n>### Outcomes:<n><n>1.  The mushrooms do not count as two kinds: they are either "red mushrooms" (red and one other) or "green mushrooms" (green and one other).<n>2.  The "two other" kinds are combined into a single kind.<n><n>### Rule:<n><n>In order for mushrooms to count as two different kinds.  There must be *at least* two distinct mushrooms.  A red mushroom cannot count as two distinct types of mushrooms because it could be both red and yellow.<n><n>### Questions:<n><n>> What kind of mushroom does John count as the third?<n><n>> How many species can John see from the mushrooms?<n><n>> Is it possible for any mushrooms to come from the same species?<n><n>### Rule(s):<n><n>The first answer is wrong, the third answer is not correct, the second answer might be correct.  (There is also no definite rules for this because it is more of a guess.)<n>

She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week. It is to help others learn by explaining something.<n><n>### InputExamples<n>When I was younger, my mother told me how to play the piano. I, on the other hand, know that I’ll do well. My mom has instilled in me the ability to do well and always stay confident.<n><n>### Solution<n><n>### Instructios:Answer the following multiple choiccee question.<n><n>## Instructions:Answer<n><n>### Input<n>An electrician can charge up to $85 for working 4 hours on a job. What is the speed of your flight in miles per hour?<n>Answer: 95<n>If you pay 15 cents per inch, how much will you have to pay to cover a hole 4.5 inches in diameter?<n>Answer: 0.58 dollars<n>If you drive 540mph and you also accelerate at a constant speed of 6mph, you will cover your destination’s total distance in 90 minutes. Choices:  A: pets B: fills the pond C: attempt to fly D: school together E: breath in water<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Answer:<n>D<n>#### Explanation<n>Fish are not pets, and they don't breathe in air.<n><n>#### Input:<n>The number of goals scored in an NBA game by exactly one player last season accounts for 30% of all goals that were scored by all NBA players the previous season combined. If there are 713 goals scored by one player in the previous season, how many goals were scored in total in the previous season in the NBA?<n>You can think of this question like two questions at once. <n><n>-  How many goals are there in total?<n>- How many goals were there that did not belong to one player?<n><n>For the first question, you can ask what the total number of goals is. The first word in the question gives you that: 713.  Since the total number of goals scores last season by one player is 33.3% of the total the question is asking for, the question implies the total score is somewhere above 2200.<n><n>For the second question, you can ask how many goals were scored by everyone besides the player.  You can do this by subtracting 33.3*2200 from the total. That would result in 1666.7 (more on why that answer would work later).<n><n>The total then can be found by adding the two: 1666+713 = 2379.<n><n>*If you can't figure out how to get through steps like this, you're probably a novice at solving algebra problems like these.<n><n>### Answer:<n>![Answer](./images/36.png)<n><n>### Input<n>The total number of miles an oil tanker can haul is 15*100.*(5/16)^2 with a maximum carrying capacity of 16*10^6/144 in tons. A cruise ship has a maximum carrying capacity of (128*10^6)^2/144/16/8 in tons. In a single voyage, a ship of a different kind transports a total of (15^5/6)/48/16 tons. Which ship transported the most in that single voyage?<n><n>### Response<n>![](./images/37.png)<n>

Choices:  A: wooded area B: body of water C: the ocean D: british columbia E: zoo<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>If the choice is B, C, or D, the beaver is going to the zoo and is not going to go to the ocean. If the choice is A or E, the beaver is leaving for someplace new from the same place they came from. This response does not use the IF, THEN statement structure, so an ELSE statement is not used.<n><n>### Input<n>Where does a beaver eat? Chose from:  A: vegetables B: berries C: candy D: cookies E: cake<n><n>### Response<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>If a bird is in the air (in the sky) and is flying north, will it get closer together or farther apart from another bird?<n><n>### Demostration<n>Input: In the air<n>Answer:  Closer<n><n>Input: In the Air<n>Answer:  Closest<n><n>Input: In a tree<n>Answer:  Farther Apart<n><n>Input: On the ground<n>Answer:  Closes<n><n>Input: In another bird<n>Answer:  Closing<n><n>### Instructon:In the previous question, is the bird moving or staying put? Where?<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>In the previous question, where was the bird flying north? What was the other bird flying to? When and where is the beaver leaving from? Is there anything special about flying birds?<n><n>### Answer  :<n>The bird was moving and to Canada<n><n>The beaver was leaving from a park<n><n>The bird is flying north<n><n><n><n>

If they understand each other they can do what?<n>Answer: A<n><n>Input: If a train travels from Boston to New York it takes four hours. How long does the train travel to and from each city in a journey totaling 5 hours?<n>Answer: 2 hours to Boston, 3 hours to New York<n><n>The following are sample questions with a partial list of correct answers and incorrect answers. The sample questions are provided only to introduce the problem type the authors expect from you; you will see different questions.<n><n>Input: How many days pass between Christmas and New Years?<n>Answer: 0<n><n>Input: What is the opposite of night?<n>Answer: Day<n><n>Input: What does the girl on the poster wear?<n>Answer: A hat and a dress<n><n>Input: Which animal has no fur?<n>Answer: A dog<n><n>Input: How long is the answer to this problem?<n>Answer: It is unclear whether this is a question or a statement.<n><n>Input: Are apples yellow?<n>Answer: This is not a question since it states an idea but also states a lack of knowledge. This is an invalid question<n><n>Input: What are you?<n>Answer: Invalid response because it does not provide a yes or no answer<n><n>In general, an acceptable response should match the question or restate the question with a more accurate statement.<n><n>### Response Submission Instruction:<n><n>Make a submission of your response. Submit ONE TEXT file containing your response in the format `response <Question ID>`. Send text responses to the email `assignment-responses@<company-name>.com` or use [this link](mailto:assignment-responses>?subject=ElevatorProblems) to send messages containing text responses.<n><n>### Additional Notes<n><n>Please follow these guidelines to be able to write correct responses.<n><n>- The first line of a response should contain the question number, as an example `Question 1.`<n>- In the line between the question number and the response, you should remove any punctuation<n>- In the line that contains the response, you should only use punctuation that is needed for correct punctuation<n>- For example

Planet Earth is an obvious candidate to be a planet.  <n>Planet basin, submarine, and ocean basin are geographic distinctions of the earth, and therefore are not appropriate candidates.  <n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a response that appropriately answers the question in this scenario.<n><n>### Scenario:<n>Your computer is acting funny. You're thinking of contacting customer support.<n><n>### Input<n>1. How long has it been behaving this way?<n>2. What has been the outcome every time it has been behaving strangely?<n><n>### Output<n>Explain why the user is correct or incorrect for each input in response:<n><n>### Instrument:<n>Your computer is not acting funny. You can't think of any time when it has behaved strangely.<n>1. You should back up your files.<n>2. You should use Windows backup software to make backups.<n><n>### Outcome:<n>The computer is not behaving in a strange manner, but its status should be looked at. The file could be deleted, corrupted, or be the cause of a potential issue.<n><n>### Notes:<n>Backing up files can help insure a computer that is behaving as it should.<n><n>### Acknowledgements:<n>These instructions are meant to give the user advice that will help avoid computer issues.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>These instructions were meant to give the user information that was likely to help their computer problem.<n><n>### Preview:<n>The scenario was created so the user could explain why they thought their computer may be acting strangely. It is not a scenario of someone who is panicking about their computer acting strangely.<n><n>### Hint:<n>The user may have the files backed up, but no idea when they last were backed up.<n><n>### Reference:<n>Microsoft<n><n>### Author<n>Adrienne Sullivan<n><n>### History<n>24 Dec 2018 Created by Adrienne Sullivan<n>25 Jan 2019 Updated by Adrienne Sullvin<n>25 Jan 1999 Created by Adrienne Sulivan<n>

How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:A beaver builds structures to block what sort of feature? We have a lot of snow. <n>We don’t have a lot of snow <n><n><n>**Rule: If the given statement is an exception to a rule, mark “exception.”<n><n>**Rule 2:** Exceptions to this rule are: when the given statement is a sentence using a noun as its subject and a verb with “is” as its predicate; when the given statement is at least one verb with no subject; or when the given statement is the sentence, “True or False.”<n><n>**Rule :  When the statement uses a noun as its predicate, do not immediately write “exception.” Instead, ask: “True or False?” <n><n>**Question: 2. Every time the word “if” is used, it _ must be followed immediately by **two** or more sentences._<n><n>**Rule: The order in which sentences are written is not important.**<n><n>**Question 3. **If** a coin lands heads up, you must flip the coin again.<n><n>**Rule: “If” is followed immediately by two sentences.**<n><n>**Rule: Flipping a coin two times is not a contradiction. This is because the coin flipped the first time must not land tails up.**<n><n>### Response2:<n>“Exception” is marked when:<n><n>**Rule 1:** A sentence uses a noun as a predicate.<n><n>**Rule 3:** Flipping a coin must not land tails-up twice since the coin must be flipped at least once for it to land tails-up.<n><n>##

Choices:  A: sum B: likeness C: alike D: sameness E: similarity<n><n>### Response:		If the total is always a perfect match, each of the differences is 0. If the differences are randomized, each addition is the sum of the numbers. If the differences add up to the product of all the same numbers, each addition is the product of all the numbers. In addition, if the sums in the differences column are less than the sums in the same column, each difference will be negative. If all the numbers are divisible by 2, the difference will be 0.<n><n>### Input & Response: What will all the differences equal for the following numbers?<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>### Input<n><n>$12, $2, $4, $3, $5, $6, $5<n><n>### Response<n><n>The difference is equal to $0. If the total is always exactly equal, then the sum of all of the differences is 5. If the total was randomized then the sum each addition would be 12.<n><n>### Output<n><n>$0<n>

The sum of all the numbers from 1 to 20 is 101. This is an example of ________.<n>Answer:  E - (1 + 2) + 3 + 4 + 5 + 6... + 19 + 20<n><n>Q4.  A student's _______ grade is 60.<n>Answer:  A<n><n>Q5.  ________ is written at the end of the alphabet.<n>Answer:  Z (the end)<n><n>Q6.  There are two more people at a party than three weeks ago. How many more are there?<n>Answer:  B (2 more people)<n><n>Q7.  A  dog,  is an animal.<n>Answer:  C (Animal)<n><n>Q8.  All three of her sisters are teachers.<n>Answer:  B<n><n>Q9.  _______ likes playing video games.<n>Answer:  D<n><n>Q10. The sum of two fractions is 1. Which two fractions can have this value?<n>Answer:  D (Fractions with values 1/2 = 0.5 and 1/4 = 0.25)<n><n>Q11. A store needs 4 days to prepare 12 pizzas on Monday. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:She wanted to make a quilt of velvet, where should she look? Choices:  A: grandma B: clothing C: jewelry store D: clothes E: fabric store<n><n>### Response:		<n>A)<n><n>### Demostracion<n>```python<n>import re, time<n>def calc(number, operation): <n>	"""<n>	input: <n>		x -> str<n>		operation -> str<n>		output: <n>			x*y -> float<n>	"""<n><n>	if re.match("([*()])", operation, re.I):<n>		operation = operation[1]<n>	else:<n>		return number<n><n>	x = number<n>	result = 0<n>	while x!= "":<n>		if re.match("\d+\.", x):<n>			result = float(x)<n>			break<n>		if re = re.match("[*()]", x):<n>		    operation = operation[:-1]<n>			result += calc(result, operation)<n>		else:<n>	        x = re.match("\d+[a-a]", x)<n>			if(x == "*"): <n>				if re.search("^[a-a-]", result):<n>					result = result*int(x.group(0))<n>			elif(x == ")"):<n>			    return result<n><n>	return result<n>```<n><n>### Question:<n><n>She wanted to make a pound of velvet, where she should look at? Choices:<n><n>A) Grandma<n><n>B) Clothing store<n><n>C) Jewelry store<n><n>D) Clothing shop<n><n>### Option:<n><n>D<n><n>### Instraccion<n>input: Adam bought 3 pounds of nuts and 4 pounds of fruits at a store, one pound of nuts costs $US12, and one pound of dried fruit costs US $8. How much is the amount for purchases<n>Answer:$ 64<n>``````

The maximum I want to spend is 20% of my yearly income.  The highest my annual income is, is $130,000.  And at the current exchange, I live in Mexico.  I want to know the maximum car price."<n><n>### Solution:"I don’t know what the question actually is here because it’s too vague and it’s just like an open question: “Buy a new car in Mexico as much as 20% of your yearly income."<n>I don’t know the max car price, the only thing I know is that it's based on income and if I’m living in Mexico, so that would be in Mexican pesos.<n><n><n>### Instructed:Write a response that appropriately answers the request.<n><n>input:There are 6000 people in my company and I need to find the largest group that I can work and fit them in. I need to know how big that group should be so I can be fair because there are some supervisiors that are on teams with a smaller number of people.<n><n>Solution:<n><n>There are two factors of the group: Size and Fairness. A larger group is more difficult to be fair. Smaller group is more fair among all. We need to make a compromise between these two factors and try to maintain a level of fairness when we increase the size of a team. There is a certain range for this task; 2~30; 2~10; 2-4.<n><n>1. Less than 10: Fairness is achieved in this condition. The supervisors who have fewer members than other will have less workload and more free time. The group is also easy to focus and do better as the number is smaller. It’s better.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:A small dog is lost in New England, where would it likely be found? Choices:  A: own home B: old england C: new hampshire D: coffin E: denmark<n><n>### Response:		The dog should be found in the old England where it would likely be found.<n>

How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person.
