How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:The band enjoyed their success and fans, they loved to what at the start of every concert? Choices:  A: hear crowd go mad B: working hard C: clap D: reproduce E: celebrate<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input-<n><n>Input: A 5 lb bag of apples costs $0.60 more than a 12 lb bag of apples.  If a 10 lb bag of apples is on sale for $4.00, how much is a 12 lb of bags?<n><n>### Response - The answer to the equation A * B - C = D <n><n>### Input -<n><n>Input: Every Thursday, Mr. Foster gets together and plays music with his friends. Mr. Foster pays $20 for every two musician, and an additional $20 to hold a concert for the people of Hull. How much does Mr. Foster pay each Thursday to play music?<n><n>### Solution - A * B - C<n>	<n>### Input <n><n>Input: The sum of two numbers is 32. One number is greater than six times the other one. What are the two numbers?<n><n>### Answer - A + B = 32<n><n>### Input  -<n><n>Input: 54 * 3 = y. If 84 + y < 100, what is y?<n>	<n>### Answer<n><n>The answer is 72<n><n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: A soccer coach has sixteen players on a team. 4 more players have joined the team because of their passion for the game.  5 out of the 4 players joined because they were not asked to join before they had to quit.  How many players did the coach have on his team in total after they joined?<n>	<n>## Answer<n>		The answer is 21<n>### Instruction<n>	If you have more than one instruction, indent the first one, and then continue to number your follow-up instructions.<n>	Always include the instructions and the response questions in your submission<n><n><n><n><n><n>### Instructions - Response<n>Write a response that appropriately answers the request.<n><! Choices(1,2,3,4,5)<n><n>### Response<n><n>There has been a spike of 10 degree in temperature but no significant change in the dog’s daily walk. This would imply that the temperature has a smaller impact on the walks or it is balanced by other factors such as the amount of leash used(distance) and the location of stops. (Note that there is a chance these events are not related but if the walk’s location is more constant, you can make a hypothesis around it)<n><n>### Input <n><n>How many candlelit dinners do they have a year? Choices(5,9,11,12,25)<n><n>## Response<n><n>It is difficult to tell whether they had more candlelit dinners this year as opposed to last year. They only had 12 dinners the previous year; so it could be that they started dating and have a much larger number of candlelit dinners planned this year. An alternative explanation is that they had not many dinners this year (6 out of the 365), thus it could be that if they do have a candlelit dinner, it is not as frequent as it used to be<n><n>### Input How Many Baked Sweat Potatoes do they eat each week? Choice (1,2,3) <n><n>### Response <n><n>They most likely eat 2 baked sweet potatoes per week. They could have consumed 1 baked sweet potato during the entire year that is 1 per quarter.<n><n>### Response for Input: (2 Choices 1&2)How many miles will 4 hours of exercise cover for someone that has lost 40 lbs 1. 4 x 5 1, 16 miles 2. 4 times 10 4, 40 miles<n><n>### Response Weight loss of 40 lbs would mean your weight has decreased by 40/ 2, which is 10 lbs per hour and this means you run a mile in 2 hours.<n><n>### Your Final Score is<n><n>Your

Choices:  A: public building B: tomb C: arena D: large building E: treasure<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Explanation:Central Passage leads to the tomb<n><n>### Input:$6000 is deposited in an account that pays 10% interest compounded monthly. What would be the value of $500 after thirty years?<n><n>### Response:$1463.04<n><n>### Explantion:The interest is calculated using the formula $500*(10%/12) = 0.009 which is about 4 cents. After 30 years that would  be 1.2 cents/month. $1 * 1.2 = 1.2 Cents, 500*$1.2 = $600. $500+600 = $1100, $1100*$0.1 or 10% annually = $110. $110+$100 = $120. $50+120 = $170. Finally $500+$170 = $670, $670 x 1.063 = $692.10<n><n>### Instructions:Solve the following question and explain your reason.<n><n>### Input:"Ashley needs a new car" is followed by two descriptions of the same car. Which one of the descriptions is more favorable to choose if Ashley is going to use the same one for at least five years? Choices:  B: a better choice<n>### Response:"A better choice"<n><n>### Explantion: Ashley would choose the one with better fuel efficiency.<n><n>### What is the value of X?<n><n>### Input$500, 25%, 24 years<n><n>### Response $1288.14<n><n>### How Much would the man spend to open a restaurant?<n><n>### Instutution: The barn cost $36,000 to build."<n><n>### Response The barn cost is $72,000 because the interest payment is $1,728.<n><n>## Expectations:<n><n>* Create and answer math problems that meet the criteria of the task.<n>* The instructions describe two to four questions with multiple choice answers

How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:What does someone need to do to begin creating art? The picture is a replica of the painting.<n><n>      B) A real painting - You can't touch or feel a photograph because it is a 2-dimensional image.<n><n>      C) A digital photograph - You can't feel, touch, or smell a painting.<n><n>  ### Answer<n><n>A) Real painting<n><n>### Question<n>A piece of art is not necessarily finished when the creator steps away from it. Choices:  -  A painting is never finished.<n><n>      - In addition to painting, some pieces are a collaboration between artists who contribute parts to a project that they can't finish alone.<n><n>### Answer:<n>B) A painting is never finished<n><n>### Question To create a collage, one might:<n><n>Choices  A:  Cut and paste magazine and newspaper images on a piece of paper.<n>Choices  B:  Cut and add images to other pictures created by other artists.<n>Choices  C:  Cut and combine pieces of clothing, fabrics, and other materials.<n>Choices  D:  Cut and glue materials into mosaics.<n>Choices  E:  Pace around a studio space, chanting and making marks on a wall.<n><n>### Response<n>A),B)  Cut and paste Magazine images and Newspaper images - A collage is usually made of a bunch of different materials as well as various mediums.<n><n>### Q:<n><n>Choices A:  Artworks with flat, 2-dimensional surfaces.<n>Choices B:  Any works made up of several different surfaces in 3-dimensional space.<n>Choices C:  Any works that don't

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>Input: Jodi starts off walking 1 mile a day for 6 days a week.  On the second week, she walks 2 miles a day, 6 days a week.  On the third week, she walks 3 miles a day, 6 days a week. Finally on the fourth week, she walks 4 miles a day, 6 days a week.  How many miles has she walked in 4 weeks?<n>Answer: 60<n><n>Input: A club is going to get additional members so that they will have 5 more than twice their current number of their members. If the club has 10 members now, how many additional members do they need?<n>Answer: 15<n><n>Input: Andrea buys herself a pony for her 30th birthday. She pays $500/month to rent a pasture for it, $10 a day for food, and $60/lesson for two lessons a week. How much does she spend on her pony in a year?<n>Answer: 15890<n><n>### Input:You might head to the locker room after getting a green drink here. Choices:  A: health club B: jocks C: fitness centre D: stadium E: gymnasium<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is D.<n><n>### Inputs:You might order a cup of coffee and a muffin here. Choices: A: cheesecake B: brownie C: bagel D: bread E: soda F: latte<n><n>### ResponseA:<n>The correct answer is D, bread.<n><n>### ResponseB:<n>The correct answer to A is F, latte. The correct answer for B is C, bread. The appropriate choice for C is F, latte, the same as the one at A, and the correct answer for D is E, soda, different from the one at A.<n><n>### Output:The number of games played for each team is summed together to form the aggregate. The team in first place has won 8 games, while the team in last place has won 1 game.<n><n>### Solution:<n>The correct solution is B, the Blue Jays are in first place. The team total of 8 is the sum of the 3 wins and the 5 losses for each team.<n><n><n><n>
